RM6150,Pipeline,"Crown Commercial Service",Open,2020-02-07T11:01:26Z,"Waste Services","Crown Commercial Services (CCS), the Authority, is putting into place a commercial agreement for
use by UK public sector bodies and future successor organisations, which include Central
Government Departments, Arms-Length Bodies and Agencies, NDPBs, Third Sector organisations,
NHS and Local Authorities, including Primary Care.
CCS aims to allow procuring departments the ability to enter into Call-Off contracts of various
The initial positon, subject to engagement is that a full waste service provision may be broken
down into multiple lots across geographical regions, for example:
Lot 1 - Municipal Waste and associated services
Lot 2 - Clinical Waste and associated services
Lot 3 - Commercial (Office) Waste and associated services
Lot 4 - Classified Waste and associated services
Lot 6 - Ad-Hoc / On-Demand Waste and associated services

Lot 7 - Waste Management and associated services.",,,"Any region","79410000 90000000 ","The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commercial Service (CCS)",supplier@crowncommercial.gov.uk,"9th Floor, The Capital Building, Old Hall Street",,Liverpool,L39PP,England,"+44 3450103503",https://www.gov.uk/ccs,,,"The purpose of this PIN is to:
1. inform that CCS is to consider an exercise to set up a contracting vehicle as described above in II.1.4
2. gauge the market interest in this procurement for waste services
3. understand how best to contract with waste suppliers, including waste management suppliers, which
operate in the UK waste sector
3. identify suppliers who would like to participate in a suite of engagements CCS intends to undertake,
including 1:1's and larger multi-supplier engagements. These engagements are intended to influence the
strategy development and may include potential customers.
Details are available here: https://ccs-agreements.cabinetoffice.gov.uk/node/7713 this website will be
periodically updated with the latest information.
To participate in the engagement process, or to register for regular comms/updates, please email:
Initial 1:1 engagement will take place during January to March 2020, with further sessions to be
communicated to those suppliers who have registered.
In developing a lot structure, CCS will consider a variety of contracting vehicles in order to:
2. Deliver market resilience and contingency measures
3. Deliver sustainable and environmentally beneficial solutions
4. Adhere to legislation, regulation and best practice methodologies
5. Incorporating Social Value principles and realisation of the associated benefits

PRJ736,Contract,"N E L Commissioning Support Unit",Awarded,2020-02-05T10:43:54Z,"London APMS GP Contract (T7)","NHS NEL CSU on behalf of NHS England London Region (hereafter referred to as ""The Authority"") invites suitably qualified and experienced providers to deliver APMS Services for a number of GP practices in London. This procurement process relates to the contracts for the provision of primary medical GP services (the Services) to be delivered through an Alternative Provider of Medical Services (APMS) contract.  The Commissioners of these services include the following Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) acting under delegated authority from NHS England
column4: NHS Bromley CCG
column5: NHS Camden CCG
column8: NHS City & Hackney CCG
column12: NHS Hounslow CCG and NHS West London CCG.  Tranche 7 (T7) of the London APMS Programme includes 15 (fifteen) individual APMS contracts in different parts of London.  The practices/lots are: Lot 1 - Bursted Wood Surgery (DA7), Bexley, Lot 2:  Queens Road Surgery (SE15) Southwark
column15: Lot 5: Brunswick Medical Centre UHPC (WC1N) Camden
column16: Lot 6: Camden Health Improvement Practice (CHIP) (NW1) Camden
column17: Lot 7: Ordnance Unity Centre for Health (EN3) Enfield
column19: Lot 9: Allerton Road Medical Centre (N16) City & Hackney
column21: Lot 11: Goodman's Field (formerly known as Whitechapel Health Centre & East 1 Health) (E1) Tower Hamlets
column22: Lot 12: Abbotts Park Health Centre (formerly known as S M A) (E10) Waltham Forest
column24: Lot 14: Heston Great West Practice (TW4) Hounslow
column25: Lot 15: Earls Court Health & Wellbeing Centre (SW5) West London. NELCSU is managing this Procurement in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (the ""Regulations""). As a result of this procurement exercise an agreement will be established with the successful Bidder for each Lot for a period of 5 years, with the Commissioner having the option to extend for up to a further 5 + 5 years, (subject to NHS England internal approval). The contract extension will be subject to a review of the delivery and performance of the contract.  All completed bids must be submitted by 12.00 (noon) on 19th July 2019. The ITT reference for this tender is PRJ736.  The Procurement process is facilitated entirely online via the stated e-procurement portal ProContract (the Portal).

column1: This procurement is split into Lots. BIP83188906,Contract,"Ministry of Defence, C&C, C&C",Closed,2020-01-31T14:01:03Z,"PROJECT ARIEL - EARLY MARKET ENGAGEMENT 2","Please provide an expression of interest in attending no later than 7th February 2020 by emailing andy.hammond587@mod.gov.uk
if your organisation is a small or medium enterprise, please make this clear in your expression of interest.

The aim of the day will be to build upon the first ARIEL EME day and provide all attendees with an update to the vision for Defence College of Logistics, Policing and Administration (DCLPA) and an insight into current operation. There will also be a brief on the Wider Training Transformation Programme. In support of this, the RFI from the original EME day and an additional RFI will be sent to attendees in relation to Training Delivery and Support Services to inform the ARIEL scope.

The Project ARIEL vision is: ""through a whole force approach, the DCLPA will deliver internationally recognised training for military, commercial, government and academic customers, while leveraging partnership and income generation opportunities for the benefit of Defence"".",,,"South East","75221000 ",,andy.hammond587@mod.gov.uk,"Worthy Down",,winchester,"SO21 2RG",UK,+4401264382561,,,,"To view this notice, register as a supplier here:
and search for the notice with reference 'UK-winchester: Military defence services.'.",05/09/2022,04/09/2032,12/02/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,250000000,0,,,,,,," ",

tender_176658/832421,Contract,"East Of England NHS Collaborative Hub",Closed,2020-01-30T11:34:50Z,"Homecare Medicines Services for Immunoglobulin Therapies","The East of England NHS Collaborative Procurement Hub (the Authority) is procuring a framework agreement for the provision of homecare medicines services for immunoglobulin therapy. Broadly this covers the dispensing and delivery of immunoglobulin products with associated equipment and ancillaries required for administration as well as options for associated nurse led care in the patients home and includes:
- Dispensing and delivery of immunoglobulin with associated equipment and ancillaries required for administration
The framework agreement will be for East of England NHS Collaborative Procurement Hub (EoECPH) Members.

Subject to successful application for associate membership this Framework Agreement will include, and be for the benefit of any publicly funded (both wholly and partially funded) entity in the United Kingdom, including Northern Ireland, Scotland, Wales and England. This will include, but is not limited to: Acute, Ambulance, Mental Health, Clinical Commissioning Groups, Health and Care Trusts, Area Teams, Local Authorities and Special Health Authorities, HSC in Northern Ireland, NHS Scotland and NHS Wales, including any successor or emerging organisations, which will include but is not limited to the emerging landscape of combined health and social care commissioners and providers. Please follow the links below to identify specific organisations:

Estimated value at ~£25m p.a. across EoECPH members (including affiliate members)",,,"Any region","85149000 ",,Pharmacy@eoecph.nhs.uk,"Victoria House, Capital Park, Fulbourn",,Cambridge,"CB21 5XB",England,,https://eoecph.bravosolution.co.uk,,"https://eoecph.bravosolution.co.uk ",,01/06/2020,31/05/2022,03/03/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,100000000,0,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",

YPO001-DN433526-71875119,Contract,YPO,Open,2020-01-28T15:13:55Z,"YPO - 000999 Training for The Emergency Services and wider Public Sector","YPO are looking for Suppliers to be appointed onto a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the provision of Training Solutions for The Emergency Services and Wider Public Sector. The DPS is designed to meet the needs of all public sector organisations which includes YPO's internal requirements and any of YPO's wholly owned associated or subsidiary companies. The end customer will place the order/s with the Provider and the Provider will deliver direct to the end customer. The DPS will cover the period from 01 April 2020 to 31 March 2022 with two options to extend for an additional 12 months. The maximum contract period will therefore be 4 years, from 01 April 2020 to 31 March 2024 (subject to an annual review, incorporating price negotiations and KPI performance).",,,"Any region","34962230 35112100 38910000 38970000 39162200 45214800 71313410 72500000 75251110 79632000 80000000 80500000 92312212 98334000 ","Contracts Team",contracts@ypo.co.uk,"41 Industrial Park",,Wakefield,"WF2 0XE","United Kingdom","+44 01924 664685",http://www.ypo.co.uk/,,,,01/04/2024,02/04/2024,31/03/2024,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,200000000,200000000,,,,,,,"Restricted ",

tender_213564/827651,Contract,HS2,Closed,2020-01-24T21:33:20Z,"project_1377 - Phase One Stations: Birmingham Curzon Street Design and Build Contract","HS2 Ltd is seeking expressions of interest from suitably experienced organisations, with the capability of delivering a Two-Stage Design and Build Contract in a challenging and multi-stakeholder and dynamic urban environment.

The successful Two-Stage Design and Build Contractor will be incentivised under the Design and Build Contract to deliver Birmingham Curzon Street Station within budget and programme, including the design, construction, commissioning and handover into service of the station and associated Works and services whilst complying with all constraints and undertakings and working collaboratively with Others and Third Party Stakeholders.

HS2 Ltd intends to award a Contract in accordance with the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 ('UCR 2016') using the negotiated procedure with prior call for competition pursuant to UCR 2016, reg. 47",,,"West Midlands","45213300 ",,scc@hs2.org.uk,"High Speed Two (HS2) Ltd, Two Snowhill, Queensway",,Birmingham,"B4 6GA",England,,,,"https://hs2.bravosolution.co.uk ",,19/05/2021,11/01/2028,12/03/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Works,571000000,0,,,,,,,"CompetitiveProcedureWithNegotiationOJEU ",

BIP466051008,Contract,"Hyde Housing Association",Awarded,2020-01-24T11:30:50Z,"Main Contractor Framework","Hyde anticipates building approximately 11 000 mixed tenure homes over the next 5 years, and we are seekingpartners to work with us to help realise this objective. Hyde wants to become synonymous with creating beautifully designed homes where people want to live, which are socially and economically successful and with quality placed at the heart of what we do. Our customers rightly demand high standards of quality and finish -whatever price they may pay for their home. This can range from a subsidised rent of 150 GBP per week rent through to 1 000 000 GBP purchase price for an apartment. The scope of works required will differ under each call-off contract, but the programme primarily covers new build residential works, with the possibility of some ancillary retail and commercial development. Successful contractors will be expected to work collaboratively with Hyde, and will be expected to have an understanding of delivering mixed tenure developments and providing added value.",,,"Any region","45210000 ",,procurementhelpdesk@hyde-housing.co.uk,"30 Park Street",,London,"SE1 9EQ",UK,+442032072570,,,"https://www.delta-esourcing.com/delta/respondToList.html?noticeId=466051008 ",,07/12/2019,05/12/2024,06/12/2019,NO,,Yes,No,No,Works,2000000000,0,06/12/2019,2000000000,"[Buxton Building Contractors|Cedar House, 91 High St

TFL001-DN458299-95986197,Contract,"Transport for London (TfL)",Closed,2020-01-22T17:13:40Z,"Maintenance and Management Contract for TfL Road Tunnels and Pumping Stations","TfL is establishing a single contract for the maintenance of TfL's road tunnels and highway pump stations as outlined in this notice. This contract is the subject of Contract Notice number : 2020/S 016-033763. The scope of the contract will include: emergency and responsive maintenance, cyclic and routine maintenance which includes minor capital renewals, safety inspections, cleaning, mechanical, electrical and control activities associated with these apparatus (assets and equipment in and associated with the tunnels and pumping station).  The contract will have a term of 8 years, with an option to extend up to a further 4 years. The scope of this contract is more particularly described in the procurement documents which are available free of charge by following the instructions below.
The procurement process is being conducted by TfL (a functional body of the Greater London Authority (GLA)) as a Competitive Procedure with Negotiation under the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.
This contract is part of a suite of contracts/frameworks which TfL wishes to place for works/services (including inspections) relating to various TfL Surface Transport assets.

To express an interest in this tender, economic operators need to complete and submit a response to the Selection Questionnaire (SQ) by the 24 February 2020 at 12:00 (mid-day). To access the procurement documents and complete and submit the SQ, an economic operator will need to be registered on the online e-tendering portal. To register or to check if you are already registered log on to https://procontract.due-north.com.  Further instructions and guidance are included in the Selection Questionnaire and other procurement documents.

TfL will host a Bidders' Conference on 6 February 2020 at TfL offices to share information about this contract. Economic operators wishing to attend should contact the person identified in this notice by 3 February 2020 for further details. For those unable to attend, all the documents and information provided will be available on the e-tendering portal.

tender_211040/815448,Pipeline,"Department for Education",Closed,2020-01-22T13:37:22Z,"Subject Knowledge Enhancement (SKE)","The Department for Education (DfE) is seeking multiple providers to design and deliver Subject Knowledge Enhancement (SKE) courses supporting recruitment to Initial Teacher Training (ITT). A framework agreement will replace the grant funding model currently in place for the SKE programme, and will be the only means of drawing down funding from the DfE for SKE courses delivered from October 2020.

SKE is a key part of the Department's teacher supply strategy and supports recruitment to ITT in hard-to-recruit subjects. It is for applicants who have an offer of a place on an ITT programme. SKE programmes are designed to help these applicants gain the depth of subject knowledge needed to train to teach their chosen subject.
Further details will be published with the tender pack.

Please note: The value is the maximum budget for funding SKE courses over the term of the framework agreement and includes both course costs and participant bursary payments. Acceptance onto the framework will not guarantee any funding and individual call-offs will be made on the instruction of the participant undertaking the SKE course.

This notice is for information only and is not a call for competition. The Department reserves the right not to enter a formal procurement process and not award contracts. Accordingly, the Authority will not be liable for any bid cost, expenditure, work or effort incurred by a provider in acting on the basis of this Prior Information Notice.

All future information will be issued to potential providers via the DfE eTendering Portal. Providers can access this system at https://education.app.jaggaer.com where the details of how to register and the terms of free registration are presented.
The intention is to publish the tender opportunity in mid-February.

All information included in this notice is indicative and subject to change.",,,"Any region","80000000 ",,SKE.inbox@education.gov.uk,"Sanctuary Buildings, Great Smith Street",,London,"SW1P 3BT",England,,,,,,01/10/2020,30/09/2024,01/01/2001,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,,122500000,0,,,,,,," ",

BIP82417086,Contract,"Ministry of Defence, C&C, Other",Awarded,2020-01-20T12:30:58Z,"Future Service Delivery Contract (FSDC): Provision of Armed Forces Pay, Pensions and Military HR and Administrative Services","The FSDC will cover the Armed Forces and Veterans Defence Business Services (DBS) services that are currently outsourced, which at a high level consist of:

a.	A variety of personnel support services for the Royal Navy, Army and Royal Air Force, in the form of Joint Personnel Administration (JPA), which is the MOD's current Military Payroll and Expenses HR system, and Pensions
b.	The development and maintenance of a range of supporting Information System (IS) applications and elements of IS infrastructure.
a.	Deliver the services in scope
b.     Enable the radical transformation and modernisation of these services
c.	Continually develop change management and ways of working

P00003316,Contract,"Portsmouth City Council",Closed,2020-01-09T14:02:40Z,"Design, Supply & Installation Solar Photovoltaic (PV) Panel Systems & Associated Equipment - Central Southern England Multi Contractor Framework","Portsmouth City Council - the 'Council' - is inviting tenders for inclusion onto a multi contractor framework agreement that will be used to let the design, supply and installation of solar PV systems and associated equipment such as, but not limited to, battery storage retrofit and electric vehicle charging points.

The Council is aiming to have established the framework agreement by April 2020. Once in place the agreement will run for a duration of 4 years extendable in increments to be agreed to a maximum term of 8 years.

The framework will be available for access to all contracting authorities - local authorities, universities, health, emergency services, etc. - situated within Hampshire, Isle of Wight, East Sussex, West Sussex, Dorset, Surrey, Wiltshire, Dorset and Oxfordshire who may use the agreement to install systems across their property portfolios. In addition, whilst this will not be the primary focus of business activity, the framework agreement may also be used to install systems onto private sector residential properties and privately owned commercial / industrial properties. Installation of systems to such properties will not be limited to the county areas stated above and may be delivered on a nationwide basis.

The Council has a direct pipeline of demand which will be let using the framework agreement and has established working relationships with a number of other eligible contracting authorities - 8 currently. However, the Council cannot provide any commitments or guarantees of usage whether directly or via other eligible contracting authorities.

The total value of work let via the framework agreement could range over 8 years from £100M based upon current expected business growth projections to £500M if a significant level of further demand is brought forward by developing further relationships with public and private sector customers. The upper value estimate of £500Mis non-binding on the Council who may let significantly higher values of work via the framework agreement to meet demand.
The framework agreement will be established via evaluation of tenders submitted for the following live Council project:
Design, Supply and Installation of 250kW Solar Photovoltaic (PV) and 10no. 5kW Batteries. Start on site 27thApril 2020 and estimated works duration of 8 weeks.

The project will be let on an individual basis to the tendering contractor who achieves the highest score following assessment of submitted bids under a JCT Minor Works Contract w/ Contractors Design.

That contractor plus the next ranking contractors up to a maximum total number of 12 will be appointed onto the framework agreement. The framework agreement will be let using the Council's standard framework terms.

A framework tiering system will be established with a primary tier made up of the highest scoring 6 contractors and a secondary tier of the next highest 6 contractors on a ranked...",,"PO1 2AL","South East","45261215 31500000 45400000 45317200 45311000 31400000 45351000 71320000 31158100 09331000 45315100 45310000 45315300 45261000 71000000 45317300 45232000 09332000 45315000 71250000 ","Procurement Service",procurement@portsmouthcc.gov.uk,"Guildhall Square",Portsmouth,Hampshire,"PO1 2AL","United Kingdom","023 9268 8235",,,"https://in-tendhost.co.uk/portsmouthcc/aspx/ ","Is a Recurrent Procurement Type? : No",01/04/2020,31/03/2024,17/02/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Works,100000000,500000000,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",

PR002114- Surgical Services,Contract,"NHS SOUTH WEST COMMISSIONING SUPPORT",Awarded,2020-01-03T12:23:51Z,"Procurement for the provision of Gender Dysphoria Surgical Services to NHS England, NHS Scotland and NHS Wales","NHS England and NHS Scotland seek bids from providers who have the capability and capacity to deliver Gender Dysphoria Surgical Services. Services being procured are Chest surgery (trans masculine), Genital surgery (trans feminine) and Genital surgery (trans masculine).

The Services will be available to individuals eligible for NHS-funded care who are ordinarily resident in England, Scotland or Wales - or otherwise who are the commissioning responsibility of the NHS in England, Scotland or Wales - and who meet the eligibility criteria described in the Service Specification. Successful Bidders will hold a single contract with NHS England for services provided to eligible patients who are the commissioning responsibility of NHS England, NHS Scotland and NHS Wales.
The NHS pathway of care for adults with gender dysphoria will differ according to the individual's goals. The envisaged adult pathway may typically be summarised as:
•	Referral to a specialist Gender Dysphoria Clinic
•	Assessment for gender dysphoria, and diagnosis

•	Individuals who meet the criteria for diagnosis of gender dysphoria are accepted on to the NHS care pathway and an individual treatment plan is agreed between the individual and their lead clinician in the Gender Dysphoria Clinic
•	Certain therapeutic interventions are delivered by the Gender Dysphoria Clinic
column2: and / or referral for interventions with other providers
column3: which may include recommendations to primary care for prescribing endocrine treatments

column1: •	Gender Dysphoria Clinic makes a referral for surgical interventions of the chest and genitals if criteria are met via a planned National Referral Support Service
•	Ongoing review and monitoring during and after interventions
•	Conclusion of contact: discharge to primary care
Contracts will be for an initial term of 5 years with a possible extension of any period up to a further 2 years as defined and at the discretion of the Commissioner.

The approach for improving the surgical market is focused on establishing a flexible contract that facilitates patient choice based on a consideration of reliable data including new quality indicators. No volumes are guaranteed on the award of a contract.

This procurement is being carried out by NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit (SCW) on behalf of the Commissioners.",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Scotland,Wales,Isle of Man,Channel Islands","85100000 ","Nicola Hayward",scwcsu.procurement@nhs.net,"South Plaza,Marlborough Street",,BRISTOL,BS13NX,England,,https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home,,,"Interested providers will be able to view this notice via the 'current tenders' list on the e-procurement system In-Tend, available on the following link: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home
In order to submit a bid, you will need to be registered on the e-procurement system and 'express an interest', and then complete a response as specified within the procurement documents.
On registration, please include at least two contacts to allow for access to the system in times of absence.

The services are healthcare services falling within Schedule 3 to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (""the Regulations"")  which are not subject to the full regime of the Regulations, but is instead governed by the ""Light Touch Regime"" contained within Chapter 3, Section 7 of the Regulations (Regulations 74 to 77).

The tendering process will be conducted in accordance with the requirements and flexibilities provided by Articles 74 to 76 of the Directive, and Regulations 74 to 76 of the Regulations. The Authority will run a transparent tender process, treating all Bidders equally. For the avoidance of doubt, the Authority will not be bound by the Regulations or the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union or any other regulations or legislation except for the specific parts or circumstances that apply to the procurement of these Services.

Neither the inclusion of a Bidder selection stage, nor the use of any language or terms found in the Directive or Regulations, nor the description of the procedure voluntarily adopted by the Authority (""Open"", ""Restricted"", ""Competitive Procedure with Negotiation"", ""Competitive Dialogue"" or any other description), nor any other indication, shall be taken to mean that the Authority intends to hold itself bound by the Directive or Regulations, save by the provisions applicable to services coming within the scope of Annex XIV of the Directive / Schedule 3 of the Regulations.

The Contracting Authority intends to voluntarily observe the award decision notices provisions and 10 day standstill period described in Regulation 86 of the Regulations. Unsuccessful Bidders will receive scores and reasons for the decision, including the characteristics and relative advantages of the winning bid and the reasons why the Bidder/application was unsuccessful. Deadline for lodging of appeals should be in accordance with Regulation 87 and Regulation 91 of the Regulations.",01/11/2019,31/10/2024,30/07/2019,YES,"PR002114- Surgical Services",No,No,No,Services,107100000,0,31/10/2019,107100000,"[Aspen Healthcare|London|NONE_OTHER||No|No][Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust|Kingston upon Hull|NONE_OTHER||No|No][Nuffield Health|Surrey|NONE_OTHER||No|No][Ramsay Healthcare|London|NONE_OTHER||No|No][Royal Cornwall Hospital NHS Trust|Truro

TFL001-DN453866-42350131,Contract,"Transport for London",Closed,2019-12-18T20:36:19Z,"Surface Transport Infrastructure Construction Framework","TfL is establishing a pan-London single lot multi-supplier framework to deliver medium to high complexity/value enhancement and renewal capital projects and programmes and associated works and services as outlined in this Contract Notice and more particularly described in the procurement documents, for use by TfL and other contracting authorities identified in this Notice. TfL intends to appoint the 5 tenderers submitting the most economically advantageous tenders onto the framework. All framework contractors will be invited to mini-compete for high complexity/value projects. The tenderers submitting the 3 most economically advantageous tenders will also be directly allocated medium complexity/value projects by TfL at the Framework commencement which will be equally distributed between the 3 tenderers, and annually thereafter. Performance against KPIs will affect future annual allocation of work.  Further details are provided in Section II.2.4 and in the procurement documents.
Estimated values in this Contract Notice do not include works that may be instructed by private developers.

tender_191980/821063,Contract,oneSource,Closed,2019-12-17T16:01:58Z,"Integrated Public Realm Services Contract","The Authority is seeking to appoint a suitably experienced and qualified contractor to deliver Integrated Public Realm Services for the London Borough of Havering consisting of the following services - Waste Collection and Recycling services, Street Cleansing services, Grounds Maintenance services, and Winter Maintenance services.
This procurement is seeking to deliver the following key strategic outcomes:
(a) Strategic Outcome 1: The Contractor delivers public realm services which make Havering Cleaner, Safer, Prouder, Together. The Contract:
i.	improves the way Havering looks and feels
ii.	makes Havering a cleaner and tidier place
iii.	makes people feel better about their surroundings
iv.	makes a positive impact on social, environmental and economic sustainability.
(b) Strategic Outcome 2:  The Contract delivers maximum value for money for the cost of the service and achieves the Authority's outcome of maintaining and enhancing its financial position.

(c) Strategic Outcome 3: The parties work together and share their respective responsibilities to implement the waste hierarchy. The Contractor delivers solutions to help the Authority continuously reduce waste and increase the recycling and composting performance. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are set to monitor and report performance.  These actions contribute positively to work towards:
i.	the achievement of the recycling targets set out in the local plans, including the Reduction and Recycling Plans and the prevailing East London Joint Waste Strategy
ii.	the reduction of the greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from the operations of the services to work towards the achievement of the Mayor's Emissions Performance Standard (EPS).
(d) Strategic Outcome 4: Technological change is embraced throughout the Contract and opportunities offered by rapid technological advancements are harnessed.
The Service Specification details the full scope of the Services for the Contract
The Authority will also dialogue with selected bidders the option of including any of the Provisional Services within the scope of the Contract.
Economic operators shall also note that the Authority has included a requirement for the development of two service delivery options (as part of the ISDS stage) as follows:
(a)	Service Delivery Option A (Street Level Properties):
Household Residual Waste: weekly collection and unlimited single use sacks
Household Dry Recycling: weekly collection and orange single use sacks
Household Garden Waste: fortnightly collection and wheeled bin for Subscribing Households only
(b)		Service Delivery Option B (Street Level Properties):
Household Residual Waste: weekly collection and one 180 litre wheeled bin
Household Dry Recycling: weekly collection and orange single use sacks
Household Food Waste: weekly collection and 23 litre kerbside container

Household Garden Waste: fortnightly collection and wheeled bin for Subscribing Households only.",,,London,"90000000 ","Natalie Naor",IntegratedPublicRealm@havering.gov.uk,"Havering Town Hall - Main Rd",,Romford,"RM1 3BD",England,,,,"https://www.capitalesourcing.com ",,01/08/2021,04/04/2038,24/01/2020,NO,,No,No,No,Services,220000000,260000000,,,,,,,"CompetitiveDialogueOJEU ",

column2: highway maintenance and improvement schemes, schools and corporate property maintenance and improvement works, new build highways & property schemes and economic development or regeneration schemes. The Capital Works Programme will be a fixed term of 4 years and comprising 2 core lots (Property & Civils) each with two sub-lots. See tender documentation for further information. Please note there will be an online questionnaire to complete along with any submitted bid. All queries and correspondence must be raised via the discussions area within the tender via The Chest. column1: BIP76025810,Contract,"Ministry of Defence, Air Support, Other",Closed,2019-12-16T10:30:11Z,"Electro-Mechanical Training Contract 2","The Defence College of Technical Training (DCTT) delivers technical training to military personnel from across Defence.  The College currently comprises of 4 Schools across a number of sites, including MOD Lyneham in Wiltshire and HMS SULTAN in Gosport.  MOD Lyneham is home to the Defence School of Electronic and Mechanical Engineering (DSEME) and the School of Army Aeronautical Engineering (SAAE), and HMS SULTAN is home to the Defence School of Marine Engineering (DSMarE) and the Royal Naval Air Engineering and Survival Equipment School (RNAESS).

The Electro-Mechanical Training Contract (EMTC) will deliver initial and subsequent electro-mechanical and marine engineering trade training and support services at both of the HMS SULTAN and MOD Lyneham sites under a single contract
column2: which will equate to circa 900,000 individual training days a year. The requirement is for a period of 5 years, subject to options for the Authority to extend for up to 2 years, as set out below. The anticipated contract start date is 1 May 21 to allow for a 6 month transition period before full service commencement from 1 November 2021.",,,"South East","80510000 80640000 80420000 80530000 80430000 80531200 80630000 80000000 ",,chris.syers212@mod.gov.uk,"RAF High Wycombe",,"Walter's Ash","HP14 4UE",UK,+441494494369,,,,"To view this notice, register as a supplier here:

column1: and search for the notice with reference 'UK-Walter's Ash: Education and training services.'.",01/05/2021,31/10/2026,27/01/2020,NO,,No,No,No,Services,185000000,0,,,,,,,"Negotiated ",

DORST001-DN451698-61234149,PreProcurement,"Dorset Council",Closed,2019-12-16T09:24:45Z,"Purbeck Gateway - Preliminary Market Consultation","Dorset Council are seeking a Strategic Development Partner to deliver several transformation projects in key locations across Dorset under the Building Better Lives programme. Valued at over £100M, it joins up health and social care in the county and provides good quality housing and care options for the people who really need it. The first project covered by this procurement is the Purbeck Gateway Project. Dorset Council, alongside NHS Dorset CCG and NHS Dorset Healthcare are seeking a development partner to design, fund, build, and manage several significant developments in Wareham across several publicly-owned pieces of land.

A Preliminary Market Consultation event will be held on 20th January 2020 from 10am at South Walks House, South Walks Road, Dorchester, DT11UZ. Representatives from Dorset Council, Dorset CCG and Dorset Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust, will be attending. This is an open invitation for all interested organisations to attend. It is requested that representatives are limited

to two people per organisation. One-to-one consultation meetings will also be made available on request, at subsequent dates after the event. For further information, to confirm your attendance at the event, and to request a copy of the options

questionnaire please contact: Sam Poole, 01305 221266, samuel.poole@dorsetcouncil.gov.uk",,,"South West","45215000 85100000 85311000 85323000 ","Sam Poole",samuel.poole@dorsetcouncil.gov.uk,"Dorset Council","South Walks House, South Walks Road",Dorchester,"DT1 1UZ",England,"+44 1305221266",https://www.dorsetcouncil.gov.uk,,,,16/12/2019,01/04/2020,20/01/2020,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,,100000000,100000000,,,,,,," ",

NLHPP00000020,Contract,"North London Waste Authority",Closed,2019-12-13T15:31:41Z,"EcoPark South Construction Works for the North London Heat and Power Project (NLHPP)","North London Waste Authority (the 'Authority') is seeking a contractor to design and construct the following works at the Edmonton EcoPark:
(i) a resource recovery facility incorporating a recycling and fuel preparation facility and a reuse and recycling centre and associated works
(ii) a building to be known as EcoPark House comprising of a visitor, community and education centre for the wider community, office accommodation and a boat canopy and associated works
(iii) laying and installation of new utilities and services to the resource recovery facility and EcoPark House

RM6169.,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Closed,2019-12-13T10:10:15Z,"Corporate Finance Services 2","Crown Commercial Service (CCS), the Authority, is replacing the existing Corporate Finance Services Framework (RM3719). The framework is a Pan Government Collaborative Agreement for the provision of corporate finance services to be utilised by central government departments and all other UK public sector bodies, including local authorities, health, police, fire and rescue, education, devolved administrations and charities. The proposed agreement will be the recommended corporate finance solution for the UK Public Sector, look to deliver value for money to the taxpayer when delivering corporate finance requirements for transactional or advisory services. The proposed Framework will consist of 7 Lots, representing the various roles that Buyers may choose to appoint 1 or more Suppliers to fulfil their requirements, at call-off stage under the CFS Framework. Each Lot sets out the scope of work that a Supplier may be required to undertake as detailed in Framework Schedule 1 Specification",,,"Any region","66122000 ","The minister for the cabinet office acting through crown commercial service",supplier@crowncommercial.gov.uk,"39 Old Hall Street",,Liverpool,L39PP,England,"+44 3450103503",https://www.gov.uk/ccs,"RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 8 Bidder Guidance (1).pdf RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 7 Key subcontractor details (1).xlsx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 6 Consortia details (1).xlsx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 5 Financial assessment template_ (1).xlsx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 4 Information and declaration workbook v2.0 (1).xlsx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 3b Award Questionnaire v1.0 (1).docx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 3a Selection Questionnaire (1).pdf RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 1 About the Framework V1.00 (1).docx Call Off Schedules-20191213T091956Z-001 (1).zip Core Terms 3.0.7.docx Joint Schedules -20191213T092010Z-001.zip Framework Schedules-20191213T091936Z-001.zip Framework Award Form v.3.6 tracked changes.docx Framework Award Form v.3.6 Clean.docx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 3c - Pricing Matrix v1.0.xlsx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 2  How to bid  v3.0 (tracked changes) (1).docx RM6169 Corporate Finance Services 2 - Attachment 2  How to bid  v3.0 (clean).docx ","https://ted.europa.eu/TED/notice/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:592100-2019:TEXT:EN:HTML ","This Framework Agreement RM6169 is for use by Contracting Authorities in the United Kingdom that exist on 13/12/2019 and which fall into one or more of the following categories:
(d)   Non-Departmental Public Bodies (NDPBs), including advisory NDPBs, executive NDPBs, and tribunal NDPBs

(k)    Educational bodies or establishments including state schools (nursery schools, primary schools, middle or high schools, secondary schools, special schools), academies, colleges, Pupil Referral Unit (PRU), further education colleges and universities
(n)   Housing associations, including registered social landlords
(q)   Councils, including county councils, district councils, county borough councils, community councils, London borough councils, unitary councils, metropolitan councils, parish councils
(v)    Civil service bodies, including public sector buying organisations.
2.       Those listed and maintained by the Government on their website at https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations or any replacement web-link.

3.       Those listed and maintained by the Office of National Statistics (ONS) at https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/nationalaccounts/uksectoraccounts/datasets/publicsectorclassificationguide or any replacement web-link.
4.       Those set out in the definition of ""Contracting Authority"" in regulation 2(1) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR), namely:
(a)    the State, regional or local authorities. This covers parliament, central government, regional government and local government
(b)   associations formed by one or more regional or local authorities

(c)    bodies governed by public law, as defined under regulation 2(1) of PCR, including any subsidiary and sponsoring department of such bodies. A body which operates in normal market conditions, aims to make a profit, and bears the losses resulting from the exercise of its activity shall not be considered as being a 'body governed by public law' since the needs in the general interest, that it has been set up to meet or been given the task of meeting, can be deemed to have an industrial or commercial character
(d)   associations formed by one or more bodies governed by public law, including any (applicable) joint venture or corporation

NEPO507,Contract,"Association Of North East Councils",Closed,2019-12-12T14:22:00Z,"NEPO507 - Travel Management Services","The Association of North East Councils Trading as the North East Procurement Organisation (NEPO) seeks to establish a Framework Agreement for the provision of a Travel Management Service for the purpose of booking all rail and air travel tickets, all hotel accommodation and any other ancillary requirements related to business travel, as provided by Travel Management Companies (TMC). The Future Framework Agreement will replace the existing NEPO507 Travel Management Services Framework Agreement which expires 31.07.20",,,"Any region","63500000 ","Nick McDonald",Nick.McDonald@nepo.org,"The Guildhall, Sandhill",,"Newcastle Upon Tyne",NE13AF,England,"0191 638 0040",https://procontract.due-north.com/Register,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=9c7cecee-1806-ea11-80fb-005056b64545&p=1c9e782c-541e-e611-8114-000c29c9ba21 ","The opportunity can be accessed via the NEPO eTender system. Suppliers wishing to be considered for this contract must register their expression of interest and submit a tender through the NEPO eTender System. If not already registered, candidates should register on the NEPO eTender system at https://procontract.due-north.com/regirster. Tenders must be submitted using the link above. Tenders submitted via post or email methods will not be accepted. If you require time-critical assistance on submitting your tender please contact the system support team on 0330 0050352. For non time-critical issues, such as passwords, general account queries and location of information etc, please contact Proactis Supplier Support Helpdesk Ticketing System (http://proactis.kayako.com/) and select ProContract V3 support. You will then need to log in or submit a ticket to register your issue. Alternatively, you can email ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com. This will automatically log a support ticket on the Proactics Supplier Support Helpdesk.

NEPO does not give any guarantee and/or warrant the actual value of goods (if any) which will be placed with the successful supplier by any contracting authority using the framework contract persuant to this process and accepts no liability there of.",01/08/2020,31/07/2026,18/12/2019,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,1000000000,0,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",

column1: ESPO has established a commercial trading company, ESPO Trading Limited, whose target clients are third sector organisations such as national and local charities, public sector mutual organisations and other organisations involved in the delivery of services to or for the public sector. The successful Supplier may be asked to enter into an additional separate framework agreement (the Second Framework) with ESPO Trading Limited on materially similar terms to that found in the tender pack to be entered into by ESPO itself.

Any Second Framework agreement will be a purely commercial agreement and will, for the avoidance of doubt, not be governed by the Public Contract Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. ESPO Trading Limited may enter into the second framework agreement with the successful supplier and make it available to third sector clients who themselves are not required to follow the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. RM6155,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Closed,2019-12-09T08:25:33Z,"Training Estate Services","This framework agreement offers the provision of training estate services across a number of training estates of various sizes and complexity for predominately the Ministry of Defence (MoD), its agencies including Defence Infrastructure Organisation (DIO) and other UK public sector bodies who have requirements to use and maintain training estates.
The training estates services the supplier shall provide on a national basis includes but shall not be limited to:
Contract Management and Contract Mobilisation Services
Management and Control of Ranges and Training Areas (MCRT) system (including the Operation of a Bidding and Allocation Management (BAMS) system)
Training Areas and Ranges Operation and Management (TAROM) Services (including services for Targets deployed overseas)
There is also the potential  for an international requirement.

column2: or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas are available at: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

column1: ESPO has established a commercial trading company, ESPO Trading Ltd, whose target clients are third sector organisations such as national and local charities, public sector mutual organisations and other organisations involved in the delivery of services to or for the public sector. The successful Supplier may be asked to enter into an additional separate framework agreement (the Second Framework) with ESPO Trading Ltd on materially similar terms to that found in the tender pack to be entered into by ESPO itself.

Any second framework agreement will be a purely commercial agreement and will, for the avoidance of doubt, not be governed by the Public Contract Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. ESPO Trading Ltd may enter into the second framework agreement with the successful supplier and make it available to third sector clients who themselves are not required to follow the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. Accordingly, this is provided for bidders' information only.",01/04/2023,31/03/2027,01/06/2020,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,,248000000,0,,,,,,," ",

tender_128527/710083,Contract,"Department for Work and Pensions",Awarded,2019-12-05T15:57:27Z,"DWP Estates Contractor Framework","DWP is looking to put in place prior to 01.04.18 a new Estates Contractor Framework providing Minor Works & Capital Projects together with all ancillary & incidental works and/or services to cater for DWP's estate, and to be made available to other Government Departments & Public Sector bodies who have a similar estate type & profile of project requirements as DWP's (detailed further in VI.3). The framework will support DWP's Estate of a national network of Job Centre Plus Offices, which are similar in nature to a retail shop with 'over the counter'style service provision. DWP also have a number of regional Corporate Centre offices requiring periodic works of refurbishment & renewal. DWP are coming to the end of a 20 year PFI contract (the PRIME Contract) which delivered Business As Usual Minor Works & Estate Change Capital Works. By the end of the PRIME contract, it is anticipated that DWP will continue to have a national network of over 700 properties across England,Scotland & Wales.",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Scotland,Wales","45000000 ",,ESTATES.PROJECTSTEAM@DWP.GSI.GOV.UK,"Caxton House",,London,"SW1H 9NA",England,,,"Suite of Contract Documents.zip FES Framework Agreement - Redacted.doc Harry Fairclough Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Interserve Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.DOC ISG Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc John Graham Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Kier Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Midas Framework Agreement v 2 Redacted.doc Mitie Framework Agreement v 2 Redacted.doc Morris & Spottiswood Framework Agreement v 2 Redacted.doc Overbury Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Resolution Framework Agreement v 2 Redacted.doc Seddon Construction Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Shaylor Group Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Speller Metcalfe Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Styles & Wood Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Wates Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc Willmott Dixon Framework Agreement v 3 Redacted.doc 190328 Lot 1 Contracts Finder Template.xlsx 190730 Lot 1 Contracts Finder Template.xlsx 191129 Lot 1 Contracts Finder Template.xlsx ","https://dwp.bravosolution.co.uk ","

1. The framework may be novated in its entirety over to the Crown Commercial Service (CCS) at any point throughout the duration of the framework however appointed suppliers will be notified 90 days in advance of the novation occurring.
2. A proportion of low value, high volume projects will be allocated to DWP's Facilities Management provider.

3. The Framework Agreement and the Call-Off contracts uploaded to Bravo Solutions as at the date of this Contract Notice are draft and will be confirmed ahead of issuing the final Invitation to Tender (ITT).
4. This framework will be accessible for use by all UK Central Government Departments and their Arms Length Bodies
column3: and, the Wider Public Sector (and any future successors to these organisations): Central Government Departments, Local Government and Public Corporations that can be accessed at the Public Sector Classification Guide: https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/nationalaccounts/uksectoraccounts/datasets/publicsectorclassificationguide. Any Call-Off under the Framework Agreement by these parties shall be for works (as more generally described under this Contract Notice) and shall be based substantially on the form of the Scope and the Template Call-Off Agreement, as issued to contractors at ITT stage.

LGSS001-DN380759-89611424,Contract,"Cambridgeshire County Council",Open,2019-12-05T15:53:06Z,"CCC Children's External Placements DPS","Please disregard the contract start date listed, this DPS started 1 Apr 2019.
Cambridgeshire County Council (CCC) (The ""Authority"") wishes to invite Tenders for the supply of services in respect of children's external placements. The services include:
Lot 1: Provision of Independent Fostering Agencies (IFA)
Lot 2: Provision of Residential Children's homes
Lot 3: Provision of Independent Schools and Education providers (ISEP)
Lot 4: Provision of Out of School Tuition (OoST)

These services will be available to children and young people aged 0-18 (up to 19 for children and adults with Special educational needs and disability - SEND) in Cambridgeshire, neighbouring authorities and where directed by specific care plans, nationally. The successful Providers will be responsible for providing this service and liaising closely with the Contract Manager identified by the Authority.

The tender is led by Cambridgeshire County Council, however Cambridgeshire County Council and Peterborough City Council (PCC) have made strategic decision to combine roles and departments to manage services across both local authorities. Peterborough will have access to the DPS in their own right.

The DPS is open for an initial term of five (5) years commencing on 1st April 2019 and ending on 31st March 2024 with the options to extend for an initial period of two (2) years, then after further review, for another two-year-period to a final one (1) year extension (5+2+2+1), up to a maximum of ten (10) years from the date of the original contract date.

The anticipated spend across PCC and CCC for the duration of the DPS is £470,184,791.00. The spend is across the two local authorities for all four lots as listed above, however it is the local authorities' intention to reduce this spend through application of the new DPS, improving outcomes for individual children and the use of the mini competitions within the DPS over  its lifetime.

The DPS is open for new applications, rounds will close periodically through out the life of the DPS, please refer to the tender for the closing date of the next round.",,,"East of England","85000000 ","David Isaacs",david.isaacs@cambridgeshire.gov.uk,"Shire Hall","Castle Hill",Cambridge,"CB3 0AP",England,"+44 1223703518",https://www.lgss.co.uk/about/,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=65cf6068-f00c-e911-80f0-005056b64545 ",,30/03/2024,31/03/2024,29/03/2024,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,470184791,470184791,,,,,,,"Open ",

LEICSCITY02-DN434602-38506876,Contract,"Leicester City Council",Closed,2019-11-29T14:55:27Z,"ASC0257 - Supported Living Services","Leicester City Council ('the 'Authority') invites Tenders for the provision of Supported Living Services (""the Services""). Up to a maximum number of providers to be awarded for each Lot as follows: Lot 1 - Enablement Supported Living Services for people with Learning Disability and Mental Health (up to 15 providers). Lot 2 - Living Well Supported Living Services for older people and people living with dementia (up to 5 providers). Lot 3 - Living Well Supported Living Services for people with a physical and sensory disability (up to 10 providers). Lot 4 - Specialist Supported Living Services for people with Complex Needs (up to 5 providers). Lot 5 - Recovery Supported Living Services for people with Complex Adult Mental Health (up to 1 provider). Tenders may be submitted by a Tenderer for all or any of the Lots listed above. The initial term of the Framework Agreements for Lot 1, Lot 2, Lot 3 and Lot 4 is 5 years from the Service Commencement Date 2nd November 2020 and expire on 2nd November 2025, with the option to extend for 2 further periods of up to no more than 24 months in total i.e. potentially 7 years from and including the Service Commencement Date. The initial term of the Lot 5 block contract is 5 years from the Service Commencement Date 2nd November 2020 and expire on 2nd November 2025, with the option to extend for 2 further periods of up to no more than 24 months in total i.e. potentially 7 years from and including the Service Commencement Date. It is the Authority's preliminary view that TUPE may apply in respect of these Contracts. A Tenderers Information Session is being held on the 14th Nov 2019. Further details regarding how to register for this session is contained within the Invitation to Tender documentation. The Authority is conducting this procurement under the Light Touch Regime for Social and Other Specific Services, as set out in the Public Contract Regulations 2015, at Section 7 (Regulations 74 to 77) and Schedule 3. The procurement process will not be conducted under the Public Contract Regulations 2015
column2: however, it will be similar to that of an Open procedure. The Process will, unlike an Open Procedure, include the flexibility, as allowed under the Light Touch Regime with various evaluation stages as detailed in this Invitation to Tender documentation.",,,"East Midlands","85000000 98000000 ","Yatish Shah",procurement-asc@leicester.gov.uk,"City Hall","115 Charles Street",Leicester,"LE1 1FZ","United Kingdom","+44 1164542348",http://www.leicester.gov.uk,,,,02/11/2020,31/10/2027,11/12/2019,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,140010000,140010000,,,,,,,"Open ",

column1: RM6119,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Closed,2019-11-29T08:21:01Z,"Furniture and Associated Services","This Framework will provide Furniture and Associated Services to the Public Sector Buyers detailed in the Contract Notice Authorised Customer List.
The new Framework Contract will replace the existing Supply, Delivery and Installation of Furniture and Associated Services Framework (RM3812).
The policy drivers supporting the development and procurement of this Framework are to:
o Provide Buyers with a route to market compliant with EU regulations
o Offer a simplified agreement for both Buyers and Suppliers
o Be attractive to Small-Medium Sized Enterprises (SMEs)
The Supplier shall provide services to Buyers in the jurisdictional area of England and Wales.

This Framework will consist of 8 lots. The Framework will be established for 36 months with the option to extend for up to a further period of 12 months. ESPO001-DN448516-32496547,Pipeline,ESPO,Closed,2019-11-25T10:08:07Z,"203_20 Technology Enabled Care Services (TECS)","Please note this is a Prior Information Notice and tender documentation is not available yet.

This procurement is intended to create a list of pre-approved providers of technology enabled care services including telecare and telehealth services and equipment, monitoring, response services and consultancy. The framework is intended to meet the needs of a fully outsourced provision as well as the purchase of individual pieces of equipment. Pre-market engagement will inform the nature and format of the solution to be procured.

Lot 1: 203_20 Technology Enabled Care Services (TECS) - Lotting structure to be determined by the pre market engagement. The firm period will be determined once it is known which procurement vehicle will be used.

As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined at https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities
column4: Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services
column5: NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services
column8: The Corporate Office of the House of Lords, The Corporate Officer of the House of Commons
column9: or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas are available at: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

column1: ESPO has established a commercial trading company, ESPO Trading Limited, whose target clients are third sector organisations such as national and local charities, public sector mutual organisations and other organisations involved in the delivery of services to or for the public sector. The successful Supplier may be asked to enter into an additional separate framework agreement (the Second Framework) with ESPO Trading Limited on materially similar terms to that found in the tender pack to be entered into by ESPO itself.

Any Second Framework agreement will be a purely commercial agreement and will, for the avoidance of doubt, not be governed by the Public Contract Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. ESPO Trading Limited may enter into the second framework agreement with the successful supplier and make it available to third sector clients who themselves are not required to follow the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. Accordingly, this is provided for bidders' information only.

To express an interest: (a)Go to www.eastmidstenders.org, (b) Register (c) Search for tender opportunity '203_20', (d) Express an interest.",,,"Any region","32000000 33000000 85000000 ","Food, Communities & Technology Procurement Team",tenders@espo.org,"Barnsdale Way, Grove Park",Enderby,Leicester,"LE19 1ES",England,"+44 1162944141",http://www.espo.org/,,"http://www.eastmidstenders.org ","

GPLAC001-DN421824-76862404,Contract,"Great Places Housing Group",Closed,2019-11-15T08:38:40Z,"Innovation Chain North","Innovation Chain North (ICN) is now tendering for its third consecutive framework.

The current framework has been a great success  It is our intention that the framework now being procured will commence before the current framework expires and therefore we anticipate this will be operable from June 2020 to June 2024.

The framework will include lots for main contractors, contractors to support modular build and associated professional services. This framework will run alongside a DPS for suppliers of Modular Homes.

The aim of the framework is for all clients to deliver high quality, sustainable homes that meet the current and future needs of residents whilst complying with current EU procurement regulations. ICN also aims to encourage innovation, achieve benefits from collaborative working, provide opportunities for sustainable job creation and training, whilst achieving efficiencies and value for money.",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber","45000000 71000000 ","Christine Vora",christine.vora@greatplaces.org.uk,"2A Derwent Avenue",,Manchester,"M21 7QP",England,"+44 1614475150",http://www.greatplaces.org.uk/Pages/default.aspx,,,,15/06/2020,14/06/2024,31/01/2020,NO,,No,No,No,Works,750000000,750000000,,,,,,,"Open ",

FM19001,Contract,"UK SHARED BUSINESS SERVICES LIMITED",Awarded,2019-11-14T10:12:43Z,"UKRI FM19001 BGS Hard FM Services Request for Proposal","The final date and time for the submission of bids is Monday 29th April 2019 at 11:00
DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.
All tender information MUST be submitted through the CCS eSourcing Portal.

A Contractor is required to maintain a range of Hard FM services at multiple BGS sites by providing a responsive, cost effective, efficient and quality service, which is in compliance with good practice and statutory health & safety requirements.
The Contractor's services will include, but are not limited to, the following:
•	The performance of planned preventative maintenance (PPM) tasks

•	The provision of a reactive / call out service and associated repairs on the instructions of the Employer's Help Desk. All jobs are delivered by the Help Desk via the BGS CAFM system, either by paper or electronically to a suitable device.
•	All tasks performed to SFG20 or to statutory regulations and written schemes of examination (WSE)
•	The performance of alterations, upgrades and new works instructed by the Employer
•	Attendance on other Contractors during Statutory Inspections / Audits of the relevant installations
•	Adjusting all plant time clocks, controls and external clocks on the Premises to comply with the two annual changes for British Summer Time
•	The maintenance of energy consuming plant to optimize efficiency, carry out 12-monthly energy reviews.
•	Establishing documented disaster recovery plans for the key installations, e.g. H.V., L.V. and Data Suite cooling failures.
This Specification outlines the type of work envisaged by this contract carried out as planned preventative maintenance (PPM) and reactive maintenance works.
Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the RFx attachments tab within the Emptoris System.
This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria set out in the RFP document.
As part of the strategic alliance between UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) and Crown Commercial Service (CCS), UK SBS will be using the CCS eSourcing Suite for this procurement.
To register on the CCS eSourcing portal please follow the details contained within the Additional Information section of this notice.
If you are already registered on the CCS eSourcing portal and wish to register your interest in this opportunity please email
•	the name and reference for the procurement you wish to register for
•	the name of the registered Bidder
•	the name and contact details for the registered individual sending the email.

Please disregard any content in this notice that requests your organisation ""to apply directly to the buyer"" as this unfortunately a system generated error, that is outside of the Contracting Authorities control.",,"NG12 5GG",,"79993000 ","Roz Knight",Roz.knight@uksbs.co.uk,"Polaris House",,SWINDON,SN21FF,England,"01793 867005",www.uksbs.co.uk,"Bidder Logging into Emptoris for the First Time.pdf AW5.2 Price Schedule.pdf AW4.1 Terms and Conditions.pdf Appendix B - ME Specification.pdf Appendix C - PPM Gant Chart.pdf Schedule 1 Keyworth Site Plan.pdf Schedule 2 Keyworth Scope of Works.pdf Schedule 3 Keyworth Assets.pdf Schedule 4a Keyworth PPM Schedule from Cafm.pdf Schedule 4b All Other Sites PPM Schedule from Cafm.pdf Schedule 5 TUPE Information.pdf Schedule 6 SLA ME.pdf FM19001 BGS Hard FM Services Request for Proposal Questions (RFPQ).pdf FM19001 BGS Hard FM Services  Request for Proposal (RFP) v2.pdf ","https://gpsesourcing.cabinetoffice.gov.uk ","DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER
All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, for procurement values that exceed Regulation 5 (Threshold amounts)
Responses must be received by the date in the tender documentation
column2: responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered further for this opportunity.

column1: How to Register on the CCS eSourcing Suite
If you have not yet registered on the eSourcing Suite, this can be done online at https://gpsesourcing.cabinetoffice.gov.uk by following the link 'Register for CCS eSourcing'.

Please note that, to register, you must have a valid DUNS number (as provided by Dun and Bradstreet) for the organisation which you are registering, who will be entering into a contract if invited to do so.
Once you have registered on the eSourcing Suite, a registered user can express an interest for a specific procurement. This is done by emailing expressionofinterest@crowncommercial.gov.uk.
•	name and reference for the procurement you wish to register for
•	name and contact details for the registered individual sending the email.

Crown Commercial Service will process the email and then enable the Bidder to access the procurement online via the e-Sourcing Suite. The registered user will receive a notification email to alert them once this has been done. The Sourcing documents can then be accessed on the eSourcing Suite at: https://gpsesourcing.cabinetoffice.gov.uk using the instructions detailed in the Specification documents within Contracts Finder.
As a user of the e-Sourcing Suite you will have access to Emptoris email messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you in relation to any specific RFX event.
Please note it is your responsibility to access these emails on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information.
For technical assistance on use of the e-Sourcing Suite please contact Crown Commercial Service Helpdesk: Telephone: 0345 010 3503
Training documents to support Bidders to utilise Emptoris CCS eSourcing are available in the Contracts Finder Tender documents section.
UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector
column2: helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.

column1: Where UK SBS is not named as the Contracting Authority within the documentation, UK SBS will be acting as an agent on behalf of the Contracting Authority.
Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities
column2: innovating and transforming their own organisations.

DHSC CR-G-14,Contract,"Department of Health",Awarded,2019-11-12T19:02:29Z,"GP System of Choice (2) (GPSoC)        Note: Published for completeness, see description for details","GPSoC - allows the provision and delivery of GP Clinical IT systems in England. GPSoC has successfully delivered a flexible mechanism for contracting GP clinical IT systems in GP practices since 2007. At present, 75% of GP practices use a system provided through the framework. The GPSoC Framework includes new services for GP practices and patients in addition to the GP Clinical IT systems that all practices currently use, which are referred to as Principal Clinical Systems under the new arrangements. GP practices and patients will now also be able to select Subsidiary Modules from the framework that offer additional functionality and are integrated with Principal Clinical Systems.        Note: Published for completeness, see description for details       This contract award was not published at the time of award. It has been published for transparency purposes to provide a record of existing departmental contracts., and this contract award predates the launch of this current version of Contracts Finder. It has been published for transparency purposes to provide a record of existing departmental contracts.",,"SW1H 0EU",,"48814000 ","Helen Kelly",cm@dhsc.gov.uk,"39 Victoria Street",,London,"SW1H 0EU",England,,,,,,28/03/2014,31/12/2019,27/03/2014,YES,"DHSC CR-G-14",Yes,Yes,No,Services,136341907,137800000,27/03/2014,137800000,"[Egton Medical Information Systems|Rawdon House

Hampshire Deregistration Partnership Register,Contract,"HAMPSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL",Awarded,2019-11-11T16:47:35Z,AS09292,"The HDPR is a bespoke procurement vehicle under the light touch regime effectively operating as a hybrid between a traditional framework and dynamic purchasing system. A full description of the HDPR, how it operates, how to apply and how services will be called off is available in Document 4 of the procurement documentation.

The HDPR will remain open for applications for the duration of its lifespan (4+2 years). Application is by way of submitting a completed application form. There will be a temporary closure period between 5.9.2016 and 16.9.2016 for the development of the master timeline in conjunction with providers who have submitted applications prior to the closure period. During this time new applications will not be evaluated. The order of call-offs will be determined with reference to the master timeline.

The HDPR is open to all providers of residential care (excluding older persons residential care) operating in Hampshire and providing services to Hampshire service users.",,,"South East","85311000 ","Robert Jones",rob.jones@hants.gov.uk,"The Castle",,WINCHESTER,SO238ZB,England,01962813984,,,,"From April 2019 the authority will publish regular quarterly updates to the list of providers added to the HDPR via a public webpage, accessible via the following link: https://www.hants.gov.uk/business/procurement/contract-award-notices/AS09292-hampshire-de-registration-partnership.

The total value of £115,000,000 is the total estimated value awarded to providers over the lifetime of the contract.",12/01/2017,19/07/2020,20/07/2016,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,115000000,0,20/07/2016,115000000,"[Please see the links in Section 5|Please see the links in Section 5|NONE||Yes|Yes]",,12/01/2017,19/07/2020,"Other Call off contract under the Light Touch Regulations",

tender_189944/807992,Contract,"Ministry of Justice.",Awarded,2019-11-08T07:38:44Z,"Prisoner Escort and Custody Services (Generation 4) - Lot North","The contract is for the provision of the 4th generation of the Prisoner Escort & Custody Services contracts (PECS) in England and Wales. The Supplier will be responsible for the movement of adult males and females from prisons and police stations to courts as well as inter-prison transfers, the movement of children and young people from Young Offender Institutions (YOIs), Secure Training Centers (STCs) and Secure Children's Homes (SCHs) as well as care and security whilst in the court custody area and in the dock.

PECS4 contractors will continue to physically transport prisoners between locations but increasingly the requirement will be to enable and support changes to the core operating model for courts, prisons and the police resulting from the implementation of MoJ reform programmes, including an increased proportion of business being delivered in a virtual environment with greater emphasis on the use of video technology.
- Escorting of adults and children and young people
- Bedwatches for Children and Young People

- Audit and Quality Assurance",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,Wales","75231220 ",,PECS4Programme@justice.gov.uk,"102 Petty France",,London,"SW1H 9AJ",England,,,"Redacted Contract - Lot North.zip ",,"
The services have been awarded in line with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR) and so pursuant to regulation 74 have been subject to the light regime.
Bids were evaluated using quality and price thresholds. The bid with lowest Price per Quality Point represented the most economically advantageous tender and was ranked first.

The contract award values have been rounded up and are 2020-21 prices which do not take into account indexation. Rate cards e.g. Tornados and Bedwatches and Pass Through costs will be additional to the contract price.",29/08/2020,28/08/2030,28/08/2020,NO,,No,No,No,Services,632000000,0,30/10/2019,632000000,"[GEO AMEY PECS Limited|Chancery Exchange, 10 Furnival Street, London, United Kingdom|COMPANIES_HOUSE|07556404|No|No]",,29/08/2020,28/08/2030,"CompetitiveProcedureWithNegotiationOJEU ",

RM6177,Pipeline,"Crown Commercial Service",Open,2019-11-07T09:13:45Z,"National Fuels (2)","Crown Commercial Service (CCS) as the Contracting Authority intends to put in place a Pan Government Collaborative Agreement for the provision of the supply of fuels to Central Government Departments and all other UK Public Sector Bodies including Local Authorities, Health, Police, Fire and Rescue, Education and Devolved Administrations across the UK, including Northern Ireland.
This will be carried out by the Open Procedure and tenders will be accepted in English only.

Crown Commercial Service, as the Authority intends to put in place an agreement for the provision of Fuels and will include but may not be limited to heating oil, automotive fuel, marine fuel, aviation fuel, biomass fuels, solid fuel and liquefied petroleum gas.  CCS are also considering the inclusion of associated services such as tank cleaning and maintenance, fuel testing, lubes and greases, fuel additives, tank metering and telemetry and any other associated services.
The exact details of the requirement, contractual arrangements and whether these requirements will be split into further lots has yet to be decided.
The value stated below is estimated and for guidance purposes only
This estimate is based on an approximation of potential public sector and current demand via existing CCS arrangements

The estimate stated does not factor in potential future increase or decrease in requirements",,,"Any region","09000000 ",supplier@crowncommercial.gov.uk,supplier@crowncommercial.gov.uk,"39 Old Hall Street",,Liverpool,L39PP,England,"+44 3450103503",https://www.gov.uk/ccs,,,"The Lot structure of this framework will be determined as a result of the engagement process, and will be confirmed within the contract notice, as will the estimated value of the agreement.",08/01/2021,07/01/2025,08/11/2020,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,,2000000000,0,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",

LGSS001-DN442146-65667972,Pipeline,LGSS,Closed,2019-11-04T13:33:11Z,"Cambridgeshire County Council Joint Cambridgeshire & Peterborough Councils Energy Project Delivery Contract","Cambridgeshire County Council, Peterborough City Council, Cambridge City Council, Fenland District Council, Huntingdonshire District Council and South Cambridgeshire District Council (the ""Framework Partners"") wish to procure a single supplier framework contract to develop, deliver and (optionally) operate energy projects on assets across their estates. The Framework Partners are also interested in extending use of the framework, once let, to other public bodies in England.
The Framework Partners energy projects to date and currently in development include:
•	Energy performance contracting retrofit projects on maintained schools and academies across Cambridgeshire
•	Energy performance contracting retrofit projects on Council owned buildings
•	Utility scale solar farm projects on the rural estate
•	Utility scale solar farm and battery energy storage projects on closed landfill sites
The Framework Partners' ambitions are to develop further energy saving and renewable energy generation projects of this nature under the proposed single supplier framework contract.

A market engagement event will be hosted in Cambridge on the afternoon of 25th November 2019. At the event representatives of the Councils will present the proposed procurement and invite questions and feedback from attendees.
Organisations that wish to attend the event are requested to confirm their interest in attending to Christopher.parkin@cambridgeshire.gov.uk by Wednesday 20th November.

The Framework Partners intend to procure in accordance with the above indicative timescales. However, they make no guarantee that the market engagement will be followed with an Invitation to Tender.",,,"East of England","71314000 ","Christopher Parkin",Christopher.parkin@cambridgeshire.gov.uk,"Energy Investment Unit, SH1315","Shire Hall",Cambridge,"CB3 0AP",England,,https://www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk/,,,"To attend the event please apply direct to Cambridgeshire County Council using the above contact details.

This will allow public sector customers to compare and switch utilities tariffs and suppliers.
Initially, the service will offer switching of gas and/or electricity products. This may be extended to other utilities e.g. water and fuels in the future.
The values noted below are estimated and for guidance purposes only and may be subject to change.
