TOWER001-DN364937-04513837,Contract,"London Borough of Tower Hamlets",Closed,2018-09-12T16:39:09Z,"P5359 Waste and Recycling Collections and Cleansing Services Contract","The contract is for the collection of household and commercial waste and recycling, street cleansing and ancillary services. It broadly covers the collection of waste from households, schools, charities, businesses, street cleaning, litter bin emptying, on-street waste and recycling containers, bulky waste collections, cleansing of parks and open spaces, market cleansing and waste collection, special events services and winter maintenance. Collected waste and recycling is to be delivered by the successful contractor to delivery points nominated by the contracting authority (see procurement documents). The contracting authority has a depot available for use in the provision of the services (see procurement documents). Economic operators may however prefer to use their own sites. Further information on the delivery points and the depot is provided in the procurement documents. The successful contractor will be required to provide vehicles and equipment for the provision of the services.This procurement is being undertaken pursuant to the competitive dialogue procedure using the electric tendering system www.londontenders.org ('portal'). Economic operators will need to register an interest on the portal in order to participate and the registration is free. All documentation available from and all communication to be conducted via the portal at https://londontenders.org.procontract/suppliers.nsf

To express interest economic operators must complete the Selection Questionnaire (SQ) included in the portal documentation. The contracting authority's needs and requirements for the contract and background information are included in the procurement documents published with this notice. It is intended that this procurement will be a streamlined competitive dialogue. There will be no outline solutions stage. Economic operators are referred to the procurement documents for further information.

The collection element of the services includes the following types of household waste: residual waste, dry recyclable waste, food waste and garden waste, clinical waste and bulky household waste. The commercial waste service will include residual waste and dry recyclable waste as a minimum. The contracting authority is keen to develop its commercial waste offering through the contract, and options particularly with regards to dry recyclable waste and the introduction of food waste collections are to be explored as part of the competitive dialogue.

In relation to the provision of finance for vehicles and equipment which individually cost more than £25,000.00 economic operators are referred to the procurement documents for information.",,,London,"50760000 90500000 90510000 90511000 90511300 90630000 ","Ambia Begum",procurement@towerhamlets.gov.uk,"Mulberry Place","5 Clove Crescent",London,"E14 2BG",England,"+44 2073640783",http://www.towerhamlets.gov.uk,,,"
List and brief description of conditions:
Will be detailed in the SQ pack.

The contracting authority will require the contract to be with a legal entity. It reserves the right to require groups of economic operators to take a particular legal form or to require a single contractor to take prime liability. Members of any group shall be jointly and severally liable. Legal bodies shall be companies, partnerships or unincorporated joint ventures.
Option to extend the contract for a period or periods of up to 8 years allowing for a maximum possible contract period of 16 years.

The contracting authority reserves the right to abandon this procurement process at any stage and/or not to award any contract. The contracting authority is assessing the option of bringing the services in-house. It is anticipated that cabinet will make a decision on the 31 October 2018. Should Cabinet decide the in-house option, this procurement process may be abandoned in whole or in part or amended to reflect the Cabinet decision. Economic operators are entirely responsible for their costs and losses incurred or arising as a result of any participation in this procurement process.

During the procurement the contracting authority will explore through dialogue if it can afford enhancements to the services, inter alia borough wide food waste collection services, and reserves the right to add to the services or omit services at its absolute discretion.

The estimated value of £450m for the entire possible contract period of 16 years is the top end of the range of value i.e. £370m to £450m estimated by the contacting authority. In arriving at this estimated range of value the contracting authority has considered without limitation current value of the services, inflation, impact of growth and potential key service change to be explored as part of the competitive dialogue.",01/04/2020,31/03/2036,15/10/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,370000000,450000000,,,,,,,"CompetitiveDialog ",

UCL-PROC-747,Contract,"UNIVERSITY COLLEGE LONDON",Closed,2018-08-30T16:35:36Z,"The Provision of UCL Institute of Neurology/Dementia Research Institute Main Contractor","The project is currently in RIBA Stage 3 which is due to complete March 2018. The emerging design proposals assume block retention of the Alexandra Wing which fronts onto Gray's Inn Road, and the full demolition of Sussex, Victoria and Levy Wings that form the courtyard behind. The three demolished wings will be replaced with new construction (2 basement levels 1 double height, 5 stories above ground and 2 stories of rooftop plant) of approximately 17,450m2, forming large and efficient floor plates suitable for modern science in response to the brief. The design proposals include a separation between the Alexandra Wing and new-build laboratory building to the rear, with connections above ground level and public realm between new and old.

The tender will be run through our Intend e-Tendering System therefore, to receive the tender documents and have an opportunity to bid for the contract you will need to register your details with Intend.

MFT 084 2018,Contract,"MANCHESTER UNIVERSITY NHS FOUNDATION TRUST",Closed,2018-08-29T13:10:59Z,"Provision of an EPR Solution for Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust","Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust (the ""Trust"") is seeking to procure a fully integrated Electronic Patient Record (EPR) system

The Trust considers that this procurement represents a unique opportunity for the 'right' Potential Provider to develop a true, clinically driven, joint-working based partnership with innovative and forward-looking Trust over the next 15 years or more. The Trust believes that this procurement offers an excellent opportunity to deliver a 'best in class' clinically driven benefits realisation package via the use of leading edge technology.
The key objectives of this procurement project are to:
•	Successfully deliver an integrated EPR system solution that satisfies current business and clinical requirements and stakeholder critical success factors.
•	Deliver measurable clinical and business benefits and an extremely impressive Return on Investment (RoI).
•	Deliver a solution that provides the scope in functionality for future innovation, development and research over time in meeting wider IM&T requirements across the Trust.
•	Ensure maximum value for money is gained in securing the solution.

This notice is supported by full SQ documentation, and an associated Potential Provider Briefing Paper, which sets out in more detail the requirements of the Trust. The SQ can be accessed, from the date of this Contract Notice, via the procurement portal (https://nhssbs.eu-supply.com). Potential Providers should look for ID reference number 32123 - MFT 084/2018 Provision of an EPR System for Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust. The closing date for completion and submission of the SQ is 12:00 noon, 6th September 2018.",,,"North West","48000000 ","Claire Barnes",claire.barnes2@mft.nhs.uk,"Cobbett House Oxford Road",,Manchester,M139WL,England,,,"7. LEICSCC001-DN361340-53695314,Contract,"Leicestershire County Council",Closed,2018-08-24T14:13:57Z,"Children's Innovation Partnership","Leicestershire County Council wishes to procure a Partner to develop a ""Children's Innovation Partnership"" (CIP) to design and deliver creative service models, which provide cost effective outcome focussed solutions, to meet the aims of the Council's Care Placement Strategy (CPS). The initial priorities will be to offer good quality cost effective residential care to meet the needs of Looked After Children (LAC) with complex behaviours and disabilities and to provide additional capacity to enhance edge of care services. The CPS covers the whole care system from point of entry in Children's Services to leaving care and aims to manage demand and provide the most cost effective placement and support services that deliver the best outcomes for children and young people. The Council wishes to enter into a collaboration agreement with an organisation or lead organisation acting for a consortium that can both design and deliver innovative services that provide improved outcomes for Leicestershire young people on the edge of care through to leaving care including children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND). The CIP will include 3 stages: design, delivery and evaluation. The Council expects the Partner to be able to bring its own financial or in kind contribution to the design stage and to the delivery stage to enhance the Councils statutory requirements in providing services to LAC and children with SEND. The Partner must have both the capacity to provide high quality advice and deliver major change in children's services. It is expected that the Partner will have the experience, expertise and quality standards to deliver the majority of services designed by the CIP and therefore must have a proven track record in providing children's services for edge of care, fostering, adoption, and permanence and care leavers. The estimated maximum annual value is £70,400,000 this is based on the 2018/19 budgets for the services covered by the CIP. The estimated maximum total value is £704,000,000 over 10 years. It is not intended that the full budget for each service area will be spent through the CIP. The Council will continue to use existing contracts and frameworks to purchase services. The scope and cost for each service delivered through the CIP will be agreed between the Council and the Partner as part of the design stage and will be within the budget envelope for existing services. The contract duration will be an initial 1 year plus an option(s) to extend for a further period or periods up to a maximum of 10 years.",,,"East Midlands","80000000 85000000 98000000 ","CFS Commissioning Support",CFScommissioningsupport@leics.gov.uk,"County Hall","Leicester Road Glenfield",Leicester,"LE3 8RA",England,,http://www.leicestershire.gov.uk,,"http://www.eastmidstenders.org ",,01/12/2018,30/11/2019,24/09/2018,NO,,No,Yes,No,Services,704000000,0,,,,,,,"Open ",

tender_176652/697610,Contract,"Department for Education",Closed,2018-08-21T12:40:16Z,"ESF SKILLS SUPPORT FOR THE WORKFORCE AND REDUNDANCY SUPPORT","The Contracting Authority in this procurement is the Secretary of State for Education acting through the Education and Skills Funding Agency (the ""ESFA""). The ESFA is an executive agency of the Department for Education, exercising functions to fund adult education and skills.

The ESFA, acting as a Co-Financing Organisation for the European Social Fund (""ESF""), is procuring education and training services to meet priorities identified by Local Enterprise Partnerships (LEPs) area European Structural and Investment Funds Sub-Committees. As a Co-Financing Organisation, the ESFA provides match funding at Priority Axis level utilising sources of funding as match for ESF funded activity.

This invitation to tender is for Priority Axis 2. 3S_ 18,Contract,Espo,Awarded,2018-08-20T16:39:31Z,"3S_18 Strategic HR Services","The principle requirement of this Framework is to provide Customers with access to a range of suitably qualified and experienced Service Providers who are able to offer a range of advice, support and a variety of Human Resources and Personnel services, both strategic and transactional.

column2: Permanent and Interim ad-hoc recruitment at all levels from Executive to Entry Level staff, candidate assessment and testing services, outplacement and career transition services and a suite of HR services which will provide Customers of all levels with flexible access to a variety of HR business process outsourcing tools.

column1: Lot 1A - Executive and Managerial Interim Recruitment - Admin, HR & Business Support
Lot 1B - Executive and Managerial Interim Recruitment - Blue Light & Emergency Services
Lot 1C - Executive and Managerial Interim Recruitment - Commercial (Finance, Procurement & Legal)

Lot 1E - Executive and Managerial Interim Recruitment - Health & Social Care
Lot 1F -Executive and Managerial Interim Recruitment - IT, Digital, Media & Marketing
Lot 7H - HR Professional Support and Helplines

Lot 7I - Statutory Employment Checks",,,"Any region","79600000 ",ESPO,tenders@espo.org,"Barnsdale Way",,LEICESTER,LE191ES,England,,www.espo.org,"3S_18 List of awarded suppliers.pdf ",,"As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU (""the Directive""), the Framework Agreement is open for use by Contracting Authorities (as defined by the Directive) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities
column4: Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services
column5: NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services
column8: or any Contracting Authority established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas are available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

column1: ESPO proposes to establish a commercial trading company whose target clients will be third sector organisations such as national and local charities, public sector mutual organisations and other organisations involved in the delivery of services to or for the public sector. The successful Supplier will be asked to enter into an additional separate framework agreement (the Second Framework) with that commercial trading company on materially similar terms to that found in the tender pack to be entered into by ESPO itself.

The Second Framework agreement will be a purely commercial agreement and will, for the avoidance of doubt, not be governed by the Public Contract Regulations 2015 or other procurement legislation. The trading company will enter into the framework agreement with the successful supplier and make it available to third sector clients who themselves are not required to follow the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or other procurement legislation. CHEAST001-DN359767-12669988,Contract,"Cheshire East Borough Council",Closed,2018-08-17T15:10:10Z,"A DPS for the Provision of Care, Support & Accommodation for Adults & Young People (16+), With Complex Learning Disabilities, Physical Disabilities & Mental Health Needs","Cheshire East Council is seeking to establish a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the future procurement of care and support services for individuals eligible for Adult and Children's social care support, including those individuals in transition to adulthood (16+) who have a learning disability, physical disability and/or mental health needs.  The DPS will also support the key priorities of the Transforming Care Programme which is underpinned by the principles set out in 'Building the Right Support' a national plan to develop community services and reduce the number of inpatient facilities for people with a learning disability and/or autism who display behaviour that challenges - including those with a mental health condition.  The service model includes all people of all ages and those with autism (including Asperger syndrome) who do not also have a learning disability (as well as those who have both a learning disability and autism), and includes those people with a learning disability and/or autism whose behaviour can lead to contact with the criminal justice system.",,,"Any region","85000000 ","Susan Shaw",susan.shaw2@cheshireeast.gov.uk,Westfields,"Middlewich Road",Sandbach,"CW11 1HZ",England,"+44 1270686620",http://www.cheshireeast.gov.uk,,"https://www.the-chest.org.uk ","

SCHG00161 Quarter 2,Contract,"Staffordshire County Council",Awarded,2018-08-16T13:21:31Z,"Residential and Nursing Care Home Services","Staffordshire County Council (the Council) has put in place a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) arrangement for the provision of residential and nursing care home services for its clients.

The Council has received applications to join the DPS from providers registered with the Care Quality Commission and has entered into a DPS Agreement for the provision of Residential and Nursing Care Home Services (the DPS Agreement) with each of the successful applicants in respect of one or more of ten lots.  The DPS arrangement will remain open up to 30 September 2019 with an option to extend for a further two years and the Council will continue to receive and consider applications to join the DPS until such closing date.
The DPS is split into the ten (10) lots described below:
Lot 3:  Residential - Physical Disability / Sensory Impairment
Lot 4:  Residential - Learning Disability / Autistic Spectrum Disorder
Lot 8:  Nursing - Physical Disability / Sensory Impairment
Lot 9:  Nursing - Learning Disability / Autistic Spectrum Disorder
Invitations to Tender for Call Off Contracts under the DPS Agreement commenced on 11 December 2017.

This Contract Award Notice relates to Call Off Contracts which have been awarded under the DPS Agreement with effect from 11 December 2017 to 10 March 2018 (inclusive).",,,"Any region","85000000 ","Mags Bevan",adultcarehomesdps@staffordshire.gov.uk,"Tipping Street",,STAFFORD,ST162DH,England,,http://www.staffordshire.gov.uk/business/procurement,"Care Home Awards 11.03.2018 to 10.06.2018.pdf ","https://www.staffordshire.gov.uk/business/procurement/DPS-Contract-Award-Notices/Residential-Nursing-Care-Home-Notices.aspx ",,11/12/2017,30/09/2021,14/07/2017,YES,"SCHG 00161",Yes,Yes,No,Services,247330000,274810000,13/07/2017,1,"[Knights Care Limited|91-97 Saltergate

PROJECT_00075,Contract,"Hampshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust",Closed,2018-08-07T11:10:37Z,"Southern Counties Pathology Procurement","Southern Counties Pathology (SCP) is a procurement consortium of NHS and Foundation Trusts that make up the NHS Improvement South 6 Pathology Network: -
- University Hospitals Southampton NHS Foundation Trust (UHS)
- One Dorset Pathology (Poole, Bournemouth and Dorchester) (ODP)
Southern Counties Pathology is not currently a Legal Entity, but it is a procurement vehicle with the aim of delivering the early procurement objectives of the South 6 Pathology Network, which are: -

- To enable the future formation of a consolidated pathology network over the next 5 years by standardising our suppliers and the equipment they supply us to deliver our High-Volume Routine Pathology Activity.

- To make early cost savings by reducing the non-pay spend on our High-Volume Routine Pathology Activity and to enable us to improve our workforce efficiency and productivity individually within our services as currently configured.
Southern Counties Pathology is therefore looking to: -
- Procure a long-term strategic partnership with core Managed Service Provider(s) (MSP)

- Appoint a single MSP provider to deliver a core managed service contract (MSC) for Lots 1 and 2 and to act as the Agent of the named Trusts for Lots 3 to 6, which will have their own MSC contractors.
- Secure MSC providers who are committed to actively supporting SCP to achieve its reconfiguration objectives during the life of the contract.
It should be understood that the members of SCP are not all at the same procurement point with some existing contracts having short and long-term periods still to run
column2: therefore suppliers should expect implementation to be phased over the life of the MSC contract. In general terms for the purposes of this Tender the implementation schedule will be generally: -

column1: - Portsmouth Hospitals NHS Trust (PHT) - Not including Microbiology
Short Term (12 Months from Contract Let)

column2: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust, Poole Hospital NHS Foundation Trust, The Royal Bournemouth and Christchurch Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust.

column1: Medium Term (18 to 24 Months from Contract Let)
Long Term (optional following  completion of existing contracts)

column1: tender_166928/691853,Contract,"NHS England",Closed,2018-08-07T09:43:07Z,"NHS Diabetes Prevention Programme - Re-procurement","As part of the NDPP, NHS England wishes to procure a Framework Agreement with 5 (five) providers who are able to provide, anywhere in England, up to 100,000 behavioural interventions aimed at preventing or delaying the onset of Type 2 diabetes in people with non-diabetic hyperglycaemia (or pre-diabetes) per annum for the initial period of the 3 year framework agreement.  The Framework Agreement will include an option for it to be extended for a further 12 months in addition to the initial 3 year term upon review.  It is anticipated that between them, the providers will deliver in the region of 100,000 behavioural interventions per annum.   During the term, NHS England reserves the right, should funding become available, to increase the number of behavioural interventions per annum. The numbers of behavioural interventions may vary during the term of the Framework Agreement and these figures are estimates only, as precise quantities of likely purchases are unknown.

The primary aim of the Service is to prevent Type 2 diabetes. All aspects of the Service should be delivered by the Provider in accordance with the NDPP outcomes and with the aim of achieving three core aims:

- Support people to achieve a healthy body weight, having appropriate regard to achievement of UK dietary recommendations related to fibre, fruit and vegetables, oily fish, saturated fat, salt and free sugars
- Achievement of the England Chief Medical Officer's (CMO) physical activity recommendations and a reduction in sedentary behaviour
- To maximise completion rates of Service Users, including across groups that share a protected characteristic.
- Reduction in incidence of diabetes among Service Users as a result of the intervention
-Reduction in weight of Service Users, where they are overweight or obese, and the maintenance of a healthy weight
- To reduce blood glucose parameters (HbA1c or Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)) in Service Users at 12 months and beyond.

As well as providing a face to face Service, the Specification for the Services requires Bidders to provide a remote digital service, where NHS England exercises its discretion to require a provider to deliver this.  Further details are set out in the ITT.",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Scotland,Wales","85100000 ","NHS England",nhsengland.commercial@nhs.net,"Quarry House, Quarry Hill",,Leeds,"LS2 7UE",England,,,,,"
Any organisation interested in providing the Services should following the details below:
The ITT reference for this procurement is: ITT_579
To register on the e-sourcing portal: https://nhsengland.bravosolution.co.uk/web/login.html
- From the Home Page, click the 'Click Here to Register' link
- Accept the terms & conditions for using the portal
- Choose a memorable username and submit
You will shortly be sent an email with your unique password, please treat this securely (if you lose it there is a'Forgot my Password' link on the portal homepage)
- Login with your unique username & password
- From the suppliers reserved area click 'ITTS's Open to All Suppliers' -this is a repository of all ITT's open to
- Browse the ITT's (there may be more than one page) and select ""NHS Diabetes Prevention Programme re-procurement by clicking on it
- Note the Details buttons on the left for Navigation and the Actions below
- Click the 'Express Interest' action -this will move the ITT from the ITT's Open to All Suppliers area to your
'My ITT's area -this is a reserved area for ITT  that you have either been invited to or expressed interest in.

For Bravo technical issues, please contact 0800 069 8630 or help@bravosolution.co.uk The deadline for organisations to submit their completed ITT responses will be the date advised in the summary section.

The Services are healthcare services which fall under ""social and other specific services"" under the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (""PCR"").  NHS England is therefore only bound by the parts of the PCR that specifically apply to social and other specific services.  As permitted by the PCR, during this procurement process, NHS England may (and reserves the right to) vary the award procedure for the Framework Agreement which may (but is not limited to) include having negotiation and/or dialogue with Bidders if required, in which case all Bidders would be notified.
Any agreements entered into will be governed by English Law and will be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the
English Courts. The Contracting Authority is not liable for any costs, charges or expenses incurred by candidates or tenderers in bidding for this contract opportunity.
The Contracting Authority reserves the right to cancel this tender process at any time and not to award any of the contracts/ any part of the contracts
BIDDER DAY - Please be aware that it is the intention that the Authority will hold a ""bidder day""on Wednesday 29th August 2018.

Exact details of the event will be communicated to all suppliers who have expressed their interest in the competition via the Bravo e-souricing portal.",31/12/2018,30/12/2021,15/10/2018,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,105000000,0,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",

EC09/01/2635,Contract,"SOUTHAMPTON CITY COUNCIL",Closed,2018-07-25T14:33:01Z,"Home Care","This procurement is for a Framework Agreement for the provision of Home Care Services for Southampton City Council. This is split into the following lots:
Lot A - Adults aged over 18 who meet the Care Act eligibility criteria for funded support, including all those who live within a housing with care environment.
Lot B - Adults aged over 18 who meet the Care Act eligibility criteria for funded support who have a learning disability and either lives within their own home or a supported living environment.
Lot C - Adults aged over 18 and children who meet the criteria for NHS funded care (Continuing Health Care for adults and Continuing Care for Children)

Lot D - Children who meet the eligibility for funded support (excluding those who sit within lot C)",,"SO14 7LY",,"85100000 85300000 ","Daniel Jackson",daniel.jackson@southampton.gov.uk,"1st Floor, One Guildhall Square",,Southampton,"SO14 7LY",England,,https://supplysouthampton.esourcingportal.com,,,"A bidders event will be held on the 26th June at NHS Southampton City Clinical Commissioning Group, NHS Commissioning HQ, Oakley Road, Millbrook, Southampton, SO16 4GX from 2pm - 4pm. TRAF001-DN299325-05770867,Contract,"Trafford Council",Closed,2018-07-24T10:13:45Z,"Children and Young People's Residential Placements Flexible Procurement System Round 2","This is the second round of the previously advertised FPS.  Bidder who have been accepted onto the previously advertised FPS need not apply.The North West Local Authorities are developing a Flexible Procurement System (FPS) to facilitate the commissioning of high quality Children's Residential Placements.    We  are looking to knowledgeable and experienced providers to work with us to transform the lives of children, enabling them to break down barriers and turn challenging situations into positive ones.

DN263579,Contract,"Sheffield City Council",Awarded,2018-07-23T17:34:47Z,"Sheffield Home Care and Supported Living Service Framework (Re-opening)","This is a REOPENING of the framework. Suppliers currently on the framework will not need to resubmit a tender. This opportunity is for new suppliers interested in providing services to Sheffield City Council only.

This Invitation to tender documentation is being made available by Sheffield City Council (""the Council"") to Providers interested in submitting a Tender for Home Care and Supported Living Services Framework. CORNWALL001-DN327830-67223786,Contract,"Cornwall Council",Closed,2018-07-20T11:07:19Z,"Built Environment Professional Services Framework - Cornwall Council","Cornwall Council is seeking to appoint consultants to a Framework Agreement consisting of 3 Lots that will be used to undertake services relating to the built environment that include Development Management, Project Management, Cost Management, Site Supervision, Health and Safety Assessment and Multi-Disciplinary Construction Design.
This procurement process is to appoint consultants to the Framework that are capable, under NEC3 forms of contract, of carrying out services on behalf of the Council .

Tenderers appointed to the Framework may be asked to provide works and services to all departments and wholly owned companies of the Council and potentially to other public sector bodies in Cornwall across the geographical area of Cornwall and Plymouth as described in the OJEU Contract Notice and Schedule 12 of the Framework Agreement.

The Development Manager will be appointed to act on behalf of the Client in the management of the development process throughout the Project lifespan, from the emergence of the initial concept to the completion of the client brief, monitoring and review of the design and construction process by others commissioned by the Capital Projects group and the transition of the project into the operational phase.

The Consultant appointed to Lot 2 will be engaged to act on behalf of the Client in the management of construction projects through the Project lifespan, from the emergence of the initial concept, through design, construction and operational phases. It is the intention of this procurement that it will be possible, through the call off process appoint the Consultant to take responsibility for:
1)	Project Management of the Employer or Organisations construction or civil engineering works project
2)	Pre and post contract Cost Management (QS) services
Each of the four principle disciplines will have a defined scope as set out in the tender documentation that applies to the various Project stages under which call off contract may apply.

The Scope of Lot 3 of the Framework sets out how the Consultant shall undertake site assessments, monitor and report on activities to ensure that this duty is carried out. Such duties include assessing and reporting on the site health and safety performance of Contractors to ensure site activities are being conducted in a safe manner and in compliance with current regulations.

It is expected that as a minimum 10-20 sites will be active concurrently, however during the school's summer holiday period the number of sites can peak at over 60 sites each requiring assessment at least once every 2 weeks. In their tender responses consultants must clearly demonstrate their ability to manage the work load.

A tenderer may submit a bid for a single lot only.",,,"South West","71000000 ","Stuart Hinde",shinde@cornwall.gov.uk,"County Hall","Treyew Road",Truro,"TR1 3AY","United Kingdom","+44 1872327411",http://www.cornwall.gov.uk,,"www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk ",,01/10/2018,30/09/2022,31/08/2018,NO,,No,No,No,Services,120000000,120000000,,,,,,,"Open ",

PseudoDPS21599,Contract,"Peterborough City Council",Closed,2018-07-19T13:54:10Z,"Adult Residential, Nursing and Dementia Care Placement Services","Peterborough City Council is commissioning residential, nursing and dementia Care Services.

Peterborough City Council requires  Providers of residential, nursing and dementia care to support vulnerable adults who have been assessed by the Council as having eligible need that could be effectively supported in a care home setting and have a legal right to live in a care home of their choice under the The Care and Support (Choice of Accommodation) Regulations 2014 No. 2670 and any subsequent amendments.",,,"Any region","85144100 ","Ewa Klimek",ewa.klimek@peterborough.gov.uk,"Town Hall",,PETERBOROUGH,PE11HF,England,01733384646,https://www.peterborough.gov.uk/business/supplying-the-council/supply-opportunities/,,"https://secure.sourcedogg.com/profile/57fad8bb-8f6a-4ab1-afeb-531e2ec7e009/requests/21599 ",,01/12/2018,30/11/2028,26/08/2018,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,204000000,210000000,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",
PNL00001096,Pipeline,"NHS SUPPLY CHAIN",Closed,2018-07-19T11:10:41Z,"Respiratory Solutions","This Framework is for the supply of Respiratory and Suction Consumables with products covering
column2: Facemasks, nasal cannula, nebulisation products, oxygen tubing, venture barrels, sterile water, humidification products, catheters and connectors, air cushion, anaesthetic facemasks, manual resuscitators, re-breathing bags, corrugated tubing, resuscitation dummy / mannequin, anatomical anaesthetic facemasks, compressor nebulisor, spirometer, bacterial viral filter, suction catheters, suction tubing, yankauers, suction canisters, chest drainage devices, manual and powered suction devices.

CORNWALL001-DN316610-14423321,Contract,"Cornwall Council",Closed,2018-07-03T16:09:49Z,"Waste and Recycling Collection, Street and Public Open Space Cleansing Services Contract","Cornwall Council (the Authority) seeks a suitably experienced and accredited Services Provider to provide a comprehensive range of waste and recycling collection, street and public open space cleansing services across the whole of the County of Cornwall. The contract will cover the collection of dry recyclable, residual and biologically degradable waste from households and commercial properties, and the cleansing of streets and public open spaces, including beaches, as well as the service provision for the likes of Office Waste, Bulky Waste, Clinical Waste and other associated services. The Authority seeks to contract with a Services Provider that can actively manage materials used and discarded in Cornwall in a sustainable manner to improve the value of these services in Cornwall to all customers, and the cleanliness of the County. The Authority will require the successful Services Provider to implement a range of Social Value based initiatives to realize Socio-economic benefits.                              The current outsourced contract for 'Waste and Recycling Collection, Street and Beach Cleansing Services' will terminate on 31st March 2020, with the new contract anticipated to commence on 1st April 2020. It is envisaged this contract will have an initial term of eight (8) years with provision to extend by a further two (2) years, with the estimated term value of the Contract being approximately 20 000 000 GBP per annum.  The overall procurement process to be adopted will be the Competitive Dialogue process, consisting of an initial Pre-Qualification (PQQ) Stage (PQQ) stage to select Tenderers for ISDS (invitation to submit detailed solutions), followed by provisional ISRS (invitation to submit a refined solution) and ISFT (invitation to submit a final tender) stages, with no ISOS (invitation to submit outline solutions) stage. There will be down-selection at the PQQ stage and the ISDS stages and possibly at the provisional ISRS stage. The Services Provider will be selected from the ISFT stage. All ISDS, provisional ISRS and ISFT submissions will be evaluated and scores and constructive feedback will be provided to Tenderers at each stage. Dialogue will precede the provisional ISRS and ISFT stages. Of particular note, for waste collection, at the ISDS stage, the Authority requires the submission of detailed solutions for both of the following service provisions : 1. Mandatory solution: Weekly recycling and food waste collections with fortnightly residual waste collections (the Welsh waste collection model)
column2: or 2. Mandatory Variant solution: Weekly residual waste collections and fortnightly recycling collections (retaining the existing collection service). The Authority will evaluate both and anticipates making a decision during December, 2018, on its preferred solution to dialogue, based on affordability. Please refer to the ISDS Guidance Document for clarity over the use of the term 'Variant' in relation to this Procurement exercise.",,,"South West","90000000 90510000 90524100 90610000 90650000 90680000 90690000 ","Mike Shillaber",Mike.Shillaber@cornwall.gov.uk,"County Hall","Treyew Road",Truro,"TR1 3AY",England,"+44 1872322716",http://www.cornwall.gov.uk,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=d730db5a-66fc-e711-80ea-005056b64545 ","

column1: In the event that the Authority choses the Mandatory solution then the Authority will require the new services to be provided within the first 15 months of the Contract i.e. by no later than the end of June 2021.                                                                                                                                                           Interested Services Providers may proceed directly via https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk (Due North), Project reference DN316610, to commence completion of the electronic Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ) with the return date and time, for that initial stage of the overall procurement process, being Friday, 3rd August, 2018 at 15:00 hours GMT.                                                   However, in order to acquire electronically, all of the corresponding supporting information related to this Contract opportunity, to assist you in helping to determine your intention to submit detailed tendered solutions, assuming your PQQ return is satisfactory and within the top 5 scored responses, please complete and return BOTH of the documents attached within Due North, i.e., the Confidentiality Agreement and the OS Contractor License Agreement, via the Due North messaging system ONLY. On doing so satisfactorily, Services Providers will then be issued with a letter containing instructions and a password to enable them to access and download all of the supporting information available.                                                                                                                                 The Authority would like to make Services Providers aware of a Provider Information Event, on Thursday September 20th, 2018. Related to that is a question within the PQQ, designed to assist the Authority with the planning of this event, for which invitations will be issued at a later date, but only to those Organisations short listed, following the PQQ evaluation exercise during August 2018.",01/04/2020,30/03/2030,03/08/2018,NO,,No,No,No,Services,200000000,200000000,,,,,,,"CompetitiveDialog ",

column1: RM6109,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Closed,2018-06-29T15:27:42Z,"Radio Network Infrastructure Replacement","HM Coastguard are required to monitor VHF & MF Radio transmissions from vessels at sea and provide assistance in case of emergency to prevent loss of life within the UK's jurisdiction. In order to do this, the current network consists of 155 Remote Radio sites (RRS), situated around 11,000 miles of UK coastline. This network facilitates all communication transmissions to and from vessels at sea and to the HM Coastguard Watch Officers based at our 10 Coastguard Operation Centres around the UK and the National Maritime Operations Centre in Fareham via two Data Centres.
The existing network that links these remote radio sites to the HMCG Operations Centres needs to be replaced
column2: the reason is that the analogue Kilostream product that underpins the existing network is being withdrawn from the market in March 2020 by BT in line with a wider OFCOM deregulation of low bandwidth analogue point-to-point product types across the telecommunications industry.",,,"Any region","32412100 ","Richard Skeats",contracts@mcga.gov.uk,"Maritime and Coastguard Agency","105 Commercial Road",Southampton,"SO15 1EG",England,"44 2038172476",https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/maritime-and-coastguard-agency,"MCA Contract Notice Submission to EU.pdf MCA Contract Notice.pdf Radio Network Infrastructure Replacement SQ - Version 8.0.docx ",,"IMPORTANT: This  Notice is  an extract of the information provided within the Contract Notice. Potential suppliers are strongly urged to carefully read the more detailed information contained within the Contract Notice, a copy of the information submitted to the Official Journal of the European Union is provided as an attachment to this Notice.

column1: Access to the procurement documents is restricted. Further information can be obtained at

Maritime and Coastguard Agency will not be liable for any costs of any nature incurred by suppliers (or any of its joint venture or consortium members or subcontractors) involved in this procurement exercise and suppliers bid at their own risk and expense including without limit if Maritime and Coastguard Agency cancel the procurement or make no award.

Contracting authorities shall exclude an economic operator from participation in a procurement procedure in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 Regulation 57 and the Supplier Qualification Pack.

Suppliers must submit the information required in the Supplier Questionnaire pack by the deadline of 11:00 on 27th July 2018, in accordance with the requirements set out in the Supplier Questionnaire pack.

Please note the contract value provided is an estimate. Suppliers are not guaranteed business through this contractual agreement.",01/04/2019,01/04/2029,27/07/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,130000000,0,,,,,,,"CompetitiveProcedureWithNegotiationOJEU ",

RTL088P - DPS,Contract,"N E L Commissioning Support Unit",Open,2018-06-25T17:43:19Z,"DPS Lite  - Orthodontic Services in London","PLEASE NOTE: The deadline for submission of Selection Questionnaire (SQ) for PDS contracts that form part of this procurement  (with start date of 2019)  has now CLOSED. Although the Bidders  can still submit an SQ response and get accredited on the DPS Lite,  there are no more contracts in the pipeline and there may not be any more opportunities to tender for. Updated 05 June 2018.
NHS England (London Region) (hereafter referred to as ""the Commissioner"") is seeking to re-commission Orthodontic services for London (""the Service"").
The ambition of NHS England is to bring equity and excellence to the provision of care and treatment.
NHS England are the Contracting Authority (hereafter referred to as ""the Authority"") for this procurement.
These service contracts are split into 40 Lots. (Please see the attachment provided in this advert for further details on the Lots).

The Commissioner reserves the right to change the Lot boundary in order to provide sufficient coverage across all areas in London. All the estimated contract values quoted are for the full term of 10 years, unless explicitly stated otherwise.

The published financial envelope for this service has been calculated on the basis of estimated activity levels. For the avoidance of doubt, while sufficient effort has been made to accurately estimate the activity levels and contract values, these are not guaranteed. Bidders should review the tender documents for more information.

The Procurement process will be facilitated entirely online via the e-procurement portal (https://procontract.due-north.com). All clarification requests and correspondence pertaining to this opportunity must be directed through the portal.
A timetable for the procurement, guidance re: process, and supplementary information relating to each contract opportunity is also available from the Portal.

The Contract awarded as a result of this procurement will be seven (7) years followed by an optional three (3) years' extension period. Therefore the maximum contract duration, if extended, will be ten (10) years. 01 October 2019 to 30 September 2029.

This procurement is being conducted using a process based on Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS), hereafter referred to as ""DPS Lite"" or ""DPSL"".   The bidders would be required to get accredited in stage one in order to be able to tender for contracts in stage two. The first stage will set up the DPSL and accredit bidders. In the second stage (ITT) the accredited bidders will be invited to tender for individual contracts.

Interested Applicants must register on the portal, express an interest, and complete and submit the online questionnaires prior to the deadline. Bidder may click on the link provided in this advert to proceed to the Procurement Portal.",,,London,"85130000 ","Ahsan Haji",ahsan.haji@nhs.net,"1 Lower Marsh",Lambeth,London,"SE1 7NT",England,,,"Ortho Lots UOA allocation and Contract Values v2.docx ","https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=34d883a3-0168-e811-80ed-005056b64545&fromAdvertEvent=True https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=4039f9f0-ca4f-e811-80eb-005056b64545&fromProjectDashboard=True ","This Tender process is being managed by NEL Commissioning Support Unit on behalf of The Authority in connection with a competitive procurement exercise that is being conducted in accordance with a process based on the Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) under the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (""the Regulations"" (as amended)). The services to which this Procurement relates fall within the ""Light Touch Regime"" (LTR) governing procurement of Health, Social, Education and Other service contracts. Neither the reference to ""Dynamic Purchasing System"",  ""DPS"" , ""ITT"", ""PQQ / SQ"", the use of the term ""Tender process"", nor any other indication shall be taken to mean that the Contracting Authority intends to hold itself bound to any of the Regulations, save those applicable to LTR provisions.

The DPS will remain open and valid from the start date to a period of two years, with the option to extend for a further two years at the sole discretion of the Authority. At any time during this period the bidders can request to get accredited. However, in order to be considered for the initial invitation to tender (for the PDS contracts starting in 2019), the bidders must complete and submit the first round of SQ by its published deadline.
Methodology used to calculate estimated annual activity across London is described as follows:

The number of UOAs per lot has been decided through a calculation which starts with the Orthodontic Needs Assessment (2017), which is then proportionally reduced to fit within the existing available financial envelope and which takes into account the level of GDS Orthodontic activity which is not affected by the procurement.
It has been proposed the national price range should be from £54.89 to £58.89 (£2 below and £2 above the benchmark price).The benchmark price of £56.89 is a reasonable national benchmark price

It is well established that the cost of living, wages and operating within London is significantly higher than the national average. NHS England London considers that increasing the benchmark price by a 6.5% increase with a range £2 above and below the benchmark.
Contract holders will be paid in line with the Personal Dental Services Statement of Financial Entitlements.

898144484,Contract,"Leeds City Council",Awarded,2018-06-22T15:45:54Z,"Community Home Care Service"," This tender opportunity is for the Community Home Care service in the Leeds City Council area. The service specification sets out the range of Community Home Care services that the Council wants to make available, and the outcomes to be achieved as defined by the individual Service Users. The city will be split into 6 geographical areas, and one Primary Service Provider will operate in each of these areas. A framework agreement will also operate to supplement the primary contracts.  The Community Home Care services specified must be available to all people over the age of 18 who meet the Care Act 2014 eligibility criteria for funded support. However, the majority of people using these services will be older people. This Service responds to two significant developments in social care policy:  · A shift in focus from service inputs and outputs to the outcomes Service Users want to achieve  · That Leeds City Council promotes the introduction of Self-Directed Support through Personal Budgets, with people having more choice and control over the services they receive either through a Personal Budget or by ISF  Community Home Care is a simple way of describing the support that people receive to look after themselves and the homes they live in. The Specification incorporates Community Home Care for people who require an appropriate level of support and/or personal care and meet the Council`s eligibility criteria under: The Care Act, Care and Support (Eligibility Criteria) Regulations 2014 (the 'Eligibility Regulations'). The threshold is based on identifying how a person's needs affect their ability to achieve relevant outcomes, and how this impacts on their wellbeing.  The Specification introduces and requires new ways of working. The Council is keen to work with Service Providers to achieve the requirements in the Specification and to negotiate ways to deliver the specified outcomes. We welcome innovative approaches that add value and improve the quality of local, Community Home Care for people with eligible needs.  The contract will commence 1 st June 2016 for a duration of 5 years.  Please download the tender documentation for further information. tender_140787/682804,Contract,"Ministry of Justice.",Closed,2018-06-22T09:35:57Z,"Prisoner Escort and Custody Services In England and Wales (Generation 4)","This notice launches the competition for the provision of the 4th generation of the Prisoner Escort and Custody Services contracts (PECS) in England and Wales. PECS provides a critical function to a range of Criminal Justice System (CJS) stakeholders including the Police, Courts, Prisons and Youth Custody Services. The contract will be split into 2 lots, Lot N: North East, North West, Midlands and Yorkshire and Humberside and Wales, Lot S: East of England, London, South East and South West.

PECS4 contractors will continue to physically transport  prisoners between locations but increasingly the requirement will be to enable and support changes to the core operating model for courts, prisons and the police

resulting from the implementation of MoJ reform programmes, including an increased proportion of business being delivered in a virtual environment with greater emphasis on the use of video technology. PECS contractors will be responsible for the movement of adult males and females from prisons and police stations to courts as well as, inter-prison transfers, the movement of children and young people from Young Offender Institutions (YOIs), Secure Training Centres (STCs) and Secure Children's Homes (SCHs) as well as care and security whilst in the court custody area and in the dock, and transfers from courts to prisons and other nominated locations at the conclusion of court business.
- Escorting of adults and children and young people,
- Bedwatches for Children and Young People,
Each service component (adult and children and young people) will be separately specified, funded and managed.
The anticipated quantity or scope is an estimate of the potential value of the contracts and does not in any way
guarantee any level of expenditure. The estimated cost range is real in 2018, does not account for inflation and
includes any possible future changes to the requirement for services as listed in additional information of this PIN. All values should be considered as indicative only.

The award criteria will be based on the most economically advantageous tender. Potential providers will be able to bid for both lots but will only be allowed to win 1 of the lots, unless there is only one bidder across both lots, in which case both lots could be awarded to 1 bidder. Potential providers will be required to state within their response to the Selection Questionnaire (SQ) the lots they want to bid for. If potential providers bid for both lots, they must be prepared to be awarded a contract for either lot, and must not state a preference. Variant bids will not be permitted.",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Wales","75231220 ",,PECS_4_Competition@justice.gov.uk,"102 petty France",,London,"SW1H 9AJ",England,,www.gov.uk/government/organisations/justice,,,"
The services being awarded are listed within Schedule 3 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR) and
so pursuant to regulation 74 will be subject to the light regime under which the Authority is not obliged to comply
with the full requirements of the PCR. The Authority will conduct a process similar to the competitive procedure
with negotiation and will comply with its obligations of equal treatment, transparency, non-discrimination and
proportionality at all times during the procurement.
2) Objective criteria for choosing the number of candidates:
Maximum of 5 bidders for each lot will be invited to participate in the negotiation phase of the procurement
process following assessment of initial bids. Details of the objective criteria for selecting shortlisted bidders will
be set out in the procurement documents. Where the top 5 ranked bidders cannot be identified due to 2 or more
bidders being ranked in 5th place, the Authority will take through all equally ranked bidders at this rank. If all

potential providers elect to bid for both lots, the maximum number of bidders to be shortlisted will be 5. Where the top 5 ranked bidders cannot be identified due to 2 or more bidders being ranked in 5th place, the Authority
will take through all equally ranked bidders at this rank.
Economic and Financial assessment will form part of the Selection Questionnaire on a Pass / Fail basis.
The Authority will be requesting updates to the information throughout the negotiation phase and should the
criteria set out in the 6.1.4.2 of the SQ Information and Background, not be met, the Authority will exclude
Potential Providers from the process. Further details of the Authority's approach are set out in the Selection
The Authority will be performing events through its e-Sourcing Portal known as Bravo.

a) Login to the Portal with the username / password
b) Click the 'PQQs / ITTs Open To All Suppliers' link.

ITTs' page. (This is a secure area reserved for your projects only)
e) You can now access any attachments by clicking 'Buyer Attachments' in the 'PQQ/ITT Details' box
During the life of the Contract, the Authority may commission none, some or all of the additional services
- Operation of video links in public sector prisons,
- Operation of video links in police custody suites or remand hearing centres,
- Operation of Mobile Video Services for court hearings,

Note services will only be procured within England.",,,"Any region","70000000 ",,hcaproperty@hca.gsi.gov.uk,Woodlands,"Manton Lane",Bedford,"MK41 7LW","United Kingdom",,,,,"The opportunity can be accessed via the HCA eTendering system. Tenderers wishing to be considered for this contract must register their expression of interest and submit a tender through the HCA eTendering system. If not already registered, candidates should register on the HCA eTendering system at https://procontract.due-north.com/Login
All discussions, meetings and communications will be conducted in English.
The contract will be subject to English law.  Tenders and all supporting documents must be priced in GBP and all payments under the contract will be made in GBP.

This procurement and award is subject to the transparency arrangements being adopted by the UK Government. These arrangements include the publication of tender documentation issued by the HCA and the contract between the HCA and supplier.  Bidders should highlight any areas they consider commercially sensitive in order for the HCA to be able to honour our transparency obligations without undermining the bidders commercial interests.

Candidates are advised that the HCA is subject to the Freedom of Information Act 2000 (""The Act""). If a candidate considers that any of the information supplied as part of this procurement procedure should not be disclosed because of its commercial sensitivity, confidential or otherwise, they must, when providing this information, clearly identify the specific information they do not wish to be disclosed and clearly specify the reasons for its sensitivity. The HCA shall take such statements into consideration in the event that it receives a request pursuant to the Act which relates to the information provided by the interested party. Please note, it is insufficient to include a statement of confidentiality encompassing all the information provided in the response.

The HCA takes a zero-tolerance approach to bribery and corruption and sets high standards of impartiality, integrity and objectivity in relation to the stewardship of public funds and the management of its activities. The principles contained within this policy apply to both internal and external audiences, including anyone wishing to undertake business or engage with the HCA. Please refer to our Anti-bribery and Corruption Policy by visiting https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/anti-bribery-and-corruption-policy for further information.
All dates in this notice are indicative and may be amended.
The NUTS code included in this notice is ""UK"".  However, the services will only be procured in England.

tender_162531/683029,Contract,"Highways England",Closed,2018-06-20T13:54:31Z,"Delivery Integration Partners (DIP) Subcontractor opportunity","To support delivery of the UK Road Investment Strategy (RIS1 & RIS2 https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/road-investment-strategy), DIPs will design and construct highway projects across England under NEC4 standard terms, with suitable amendments. The term will be from 2018 to 2024.

The framework will be divided into 8 lots, with each lot having a specific value threshold for work packages and covering a defined geographical area. Lots 1 to 3 (Band A) are for work packages not exceeding £100m, lots 4 to 8 (Band B) are for work packages exceeding £100m. Candidates who apply in lots 1 to 3, will not be permitted to also apply in lots 4 to 8.

Successful DIPs will be guaranteed an initial package of work under each lot with subsequent contracts being allocated either on a direct award basis or under mini-competition which may include the suppliers appointed to all lots. The procurement documents will provide more detail on how work will be allocated.

GYWCCG/Adult Community and Spec Palliative Care LIVE,Contract,"NHS ARDEN AND GREATER EAST MIDLANDS COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT",Closed,2018-06-19T15:03:28Z,"Adult Community Services and Specialist Palliative Care Services - Great Yarmouth and Waveney CCG","NHS Great Yarmouth and Waveney Clinical Commissioning Group (""the Commissioner"" / ""the CCG"") is undertaking a procurement process, that is supported by NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit, for Adult Community Services and Specialist Palliative Care Services
The in scope services included are:

•	Proactive Services providing routine services with planned appointments and interventions within community settings, including GP surgeries, community facilities and patients own homes. Proactive services will support the delivery of educational and public awareness programmes and will link into public health initiatives such as smoking cessation and alternatives to A&E.

•	Reactive Services will provide unplanned urgent or crisis care for people whose health or care needs have deteriorated placing them at risk of serious decline in their condition and/or being admitted as an emergency to hospital.  These services will also support discharge from hospital e.g. the provision of a community IV therapy service. Reactive services should provide 7 day response and a consistent, appropriate and prompt response to need. Urgent care should be accessed through a single point, clinically triaged with urgent care needs being met in the most appropriate location i.e. patients own home, bed with care etc.

•	Bed Based Services will be available to cover a range of varying needs, including admission avoidance, facilitated discharge, intermediate care and palliative care. Services will provide time limited clinical based bed provision, with robust clinical accountability in place.

•	Support and Enabling Services include but are not limited to, community pharmacy support, home oxygen and wheelchair services and the management of community equipment. These services are integral to the delivery of health and care provision within the community, and must be responsive, adaptable and supportive.

•	Condition Specific Services working closely with the acute trust and primary care to ensure consistency of care for patients and access to the right resource at the right time. These services will provide initiation of the specialist management of patients, specialist resource support and expert advice, highly complex case management and training for the local health and care community. An example of this would be services to patients with diabetes.

•	Specialist Palliative Care services (see attached for more information).",,,"East of England","85000000 ","Camilla Ball",agcsu.southprocurement@nhs.net,"St John's House,30 East Street",,LEICESTER,LE16NB,England,,http://www.greatyarmouthandwaveneyccg.nhs.uk/,"READ ME - INSTRUCTIONS TO ACCESS PROCUREMENT Contracts Finder FINAL V1 18.06.18.pdf ","https://ardengemcsu.bravosolution.co.uk/ ","PLEASE SEE THE ATTACHED FOR FURTHER INFORMATION AND THE PROCUREMENT PORTAL FOR ALL REQUIREMENTS.

Full details of the qualification requirements of respondents are provided in the tender documentation on Bravo, including any requirements or rights reserved to seek guarantees as conditions precedent to contract award. The Service Specification can be found in the tender documentation on the Bravo Portal
The contract will run from 1/04/2019 - 31/03/2024 - with a discretionary option to extend for up to a further 2 years.

column1: CS11830,Contract,"Hampshire County Council",Closed,2018-06-18T11:42:31Z,"Children's Residential Care Framework","This opportunity invites tenders from quality Providers of Residential Homes, evidenced by an Ofsted rating of 'Requires Improvement to be Good' or better, to provide placements for children and young people with severe disabilities and/or complex health needs and/or challenging behaviour. There will be for some children and young people a plan designed around moving the child or young person to foster care or a return home (Reunification). It is possible that children and young people will have experienced placement breakdowns and/or abuse and/or neglect and/or loss and may demonstrate offending and/or challenging behaviours and/or be emotionally vulnerable.
The Framework will commence on 1st October 2018 and will be for a period of four years with the option to extend for a further two years.

Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk

The Defence General Munitions (DGM) Team currently manage a number of contracts with different providers for the manufacture & supply of the General Munitions (GM) portfolio. The Team is responsible for ensuring that munitions are available, sustainable, safe & reliable for Operational & Training purposes. DE&S is reviewing its procurement strategy. Project ABEL was launched by the Weapons Operating Centre to determine the optimal DGM contracting landscape for all General Munitions from 2023 onwards

An Industry Day will be held on 28th June to expose & seek feedback on concepts for competition and single source. It will allow existing & potential suppliers to contribute information to inform the Authority's procurement strategy decisions.

Potential participants will be required to provide responses to four selection questions by the 15th June, each answer being a maximum of one A4 page. Following receipt of the responses the Authority will select the participants for the Industry Day on the 28th June.
DE&S will provide the selected attendees with a further set of questions that will be discussed at the Industry Day
column2: where Industry will have an opportunity to ask questions in an open forum after which one-to-one sessions will be held to discuss the questions. DE&S will staff a room per question to allow for parallel one-to-one conversations

There will be subcategory Lots as follows:
Providers must be registered as main route providers on the education and skills funding agency Register of Approved Training Providers (RoATP).
Suppliers will need to provide their UK Provider Reference Number.
Electronic auctions may be used within the DPS, each competition call will specific if this is the case and the details for participation.
The DPS will remain open and valid from the start date of 11th July 2018 for a period of two years, with the ability to extend the operation of the DPS for a further eight years, to 10th July 2028.

Moorfields-UCL,Contract,"ROYAL INSTITUTE OF BRITISH ARCHITECTS",Closed,2018-06-07T11:57:35Z,"A new joint eye care, research and education facility for Moorfields Eye Hospital and UCL Institute of Opthalmology","A multi-disciplinary design team is sought for a proposed joint eye care, research and education facility for Moorfields Eye Hospital and UCL Institute of Ophthalmology.  This is a joint venture between
• Moorfields Eye Hospital NHS Foundation Trust (Moorfields)

The partners propose to plan, design, build and operate a new integrated care, education and research facility at a preferred site at St Pancras Hospital in London. The new facility will be flexible and modern, enabling them to bring together eye research, education and healthcare for the first time, while being focused on patients and attracting and retaining the best ophthalmic scientists, educators and clinicians.

This presents a rare and complex design challenge for architects worldwide to secure a high-profile, global opportunity to produce a design for a new, state-of-the-art facility in an important regeneration and conservation area in the heart of London.",,,London,"71000000 ","RIBA Competitions",riba.competitions@riba.org,"66 Portland Place",,LONDON,W1B1AD,England,"0113 203 1490",http://www.ribacompetitions.com/moorfields-ucl,"moorfields_ucl_design_brief.pdf ","www.ribacompetitions/moorfields-ucl ",,17/12/2018,15/07/2019,13/07/2018,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,200000000,0,,,,,,,"CompetitiveProcedureWithNegotiationOJEU ",

services and support risk avoidance and clinical governance agendas.

including affiliate members and associate members.
Affiliate members are members of an affiliated procurement organisation.
Associate members are publicly funded entities, not EoECPH members nor affiliate members, who sign the
framework customer access agreement and are subsequently granted access to this specific framework

Agreement (Schedule 7 - Call-off Procedure Annex 1) or membership of an affiliate procurement organisation,

000791,Contract,"Yorkshire Purchasing Organisation",Awarded,2018-05-31T13:52:03Z,"YPO - 000791 The Flexible Procurement and Supply of Electricity for NHH, HH and UMS","YPO are looking for a Supplier to be appointed onto a Framework Agreement for the supply of non-half hourly, half hourly and unmetered electricity supplies, as well as related ancillary services, primarily for use in the local authority sector, education sector and emergency services sector. This Framework is designed to meet the needs of both YPO and Other Contracting Authorities by establishing an agreement where the end customer will enter into an electricity supply agreement with  the supplier and the supplier will supply electricity, as well as any ancillary services that the customer requires, direct to the end customer.",,,"Any region","09310000 ",,contracts@ypo.co.uk,YPO,"41 Industrial Park",Wakefield,WF20XE,England,,,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/register?ReadForm https://www.ypo.co.uk/about/customers/ojeu-permissible-users.aspx ","To see the documentation, please go online to: https://tendering.ypo.co.uk/procontract/ypo/supplier.nsf/frm_supplier_registrati on_wizard_introduction?openform and 'Register as a Supplier'. 1. Click on the appropriate tender under 'Latest Opportunities' 2. Click the ""Register Interest"" button which is located under the ""Main Contract Detail"" 3. Click on 'ok' 4. Return back to the home page and select the ""My Opportunities"" link, located on the right hand side of your home page. 5. Select the link to the tender 6. Select ""view stage detail"" and download the documents for response.

The terms and price structures of the Framework Agreement will be agreed between YPO and the preferred bidder. YPO will mutually agree the Framework Terms and Conditions with the preferred bidder. It is a pre-requisite that some public sector boiler plate clauses will need to be included. If terms and conditions cannot be agreed between the parties within one month of being notified of preferred bidder status YPO reserve the right not to award the Contract with the preferred bidder and to negotiate terms and conditions with the provider offering the next most economically advantageous tender.

The Supplier must adhere to all KPIs as these will form part of the final framework agreement. The final column in Appendix B details the number of failures within a specified period which amounts to a repeated failure. A repeated failure shall be deemed to constitute a breach of contract and the escalation procedure must be enacted. The escalation points and timescales must be agreed and detailed in the framework agreement - this will consist of three escalation stages, after which YPO may implement an option to terminate the contract The local authorities and public sector bodies who use this framework will sign the supplier's pre-approved contract and the supplier will then manage this contract to pre-determined Key Performance Indicators.

Tenderers should be aware that the Transfer of Undertakings Protection of Employment (TUPE) regulations may apply to this Framework Agreement. TUPE is a matter between the Tenderer and the incumbent supplier. The relevant contact details at the incumbent supplier are provided below. The incumbent supplier will respond to a Tenderer query providing information appropriate for this stage of the tender process. The Tenderer is responsible for ensuring they complete their communications with the incumbent supplier in a timely manner. YPO gives no warranty as to the accuracy of any information that is provided by the incumbent supplier. Please find contact details of the current Provider within the tender documentation in order to make further enquiries.",01/04/2019,31/03/2023,16/01/2018,YES,00791,No,No,No,Products,700000000,1200000000,03/05/2018,1200000000,"[NPOWER LIMITED|Windmill Hill Business Park Whitehill Way, Swindon, Wiltshire, SN5 6PB|COMPANIES_HOUSE|03653277|No|No]",,01/04/2019,31/03/2023,"OpenOJEU ",

BIP300213858,Contract,"Essex County Council",Closed,2018-05-18T14:36:11Z,"0564 Live at Home Framework re-opening","The Live at Home Framework will be procured on a lot basis, per district. Broken down into:

TFL001-DN336524-11444040,Contract,"Transport for London",Closed,2018-05-14T15:01:49Z,"Energy for Londoners Energy Supply Company","The Mayor's ambition is for London to be zero carbon by 2050. The Mayor also wants the energy market to work better for Londoners, delivering fairer prices, helping them reduce their energy use and make the best use of smart innovations. The GLA procurement is open to innovative ideas that will deliver its desired outcomes and wants to establish a genuine collaboration with a company or consortium to achieve them.

The Contracting Authorities seek to procure a fully licensed energy supplier to offer the supply of gas and electricity to all of London's residents using branding set up by the GLA under the Mayor of London's Energy for Londoners programme
column2: and to undertake Voids Services for London Boroughs (LBs) and Housing Associations (HAs).

column1: 1. Competitively priced electricity and gas tariffs
2. Customer service and branding: Exemplary customer satisfaction
3. Innovation: Innovating to help Londoners and especially those in fuel poverty to better meet their energy needs and budget for them.
5. Data access: Provide access to all EfLSCo customer consumption data, for the GLA, LBs, contractors and research partners.
6. Financial: Generate a commission, without affecting the competitive viability of tariff structures.
7. Support the possible future transition to a fully licensed supplier or to another Service Provider.
8. Void Services: Support handling vacant properties, including installation of smart meters during void periods.

The Contracting Authorities are setting up a four (4) year Framework Agreement. The EfLSCo scheme will be delivered via a Call-Off from the Framework Agreement based on a four-year term, with the option for an extension or extensions of up to four more years. The LBs and HAs detailed may enter into Call-Off Contracts under the Framework Agreement for Voids Services.

The procurement will follow the Competitive Dialogue procedure (under PCR 2015) to allow for the agreement scope and commercial arrangements to be developed and negotiated during the process, using an outcome based specification.  During this process, comments will be invited on draft framework and call-off contracts at Initial Tender.  Upon issue with the Final Tender, Framework and call-off contracts final terms must be accepted.

Securing and management of the EfLSCo customers will be handled by the Service Provider, and all interactions will be performed by the Service Provider's staff. The estimated turnover that the Service Provider would be able to generate across the four-year term is of the order of £279 million, including Voids Services.  If the GLA choose to extend the call-off arrangement for a further four years an additional £713 million estimated turnover may be realised. All numbers are estimates and are not guaranteed by GLA and assumptions associated with customers acquired are set out in the procurement documents.",,,London,"09000000 65000000 44161110 71314200 71314300 ","Nadeem Iftikhar",NadeemIftikhar@tfl.gov.uk,"55 Broadway",,LONDON,"SW1H 0BD",England,,https://tfl.gov.uk,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=f559b8b6-d152-e811-80eb-005056b64545&fromProjectDashboard=True ","

Bidders will need to a supply licenses under the Electricity Act 1989 and Gas Act 1986 for the supply of electricity and gas respectively and have completed Controlled Market Entry before from the project Launch Date.",28/02/2019,28/02/2023,15/06/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,992000000,992000000,,,,,,,"CompetitiveDialog ",
