Out of Hospital Services v4,Contract,"NHS Shared Business Services",Closed,2018-05-04T16:50:19Z,"Out of Hospital Services","NHS Ealing CCG is looking to commission a single contract for Out of Hospital services for adults and children from May 2019. Aligned to the NW London Health and Care Partnership delivery plan, once commissioned, the provider will be responsible for the coordination and delivery of all community services in Ealing, removing the constraints of separately held multiple contracts, and providing a unique opportunity to commission care that can be fully coordinated and integrated and able to respond to patient need rather than operate in rigid service lines. This will be a building block in the development of integrated care systems for Ealing in support of the NW London Health and Care Partnership ambition for an integrated care system for North West London. It is important that the successful bidder undertakes to lead, deliver and coordinate a holistic package of community care working in an integrated and co-ordinated way with primary care and acute care. The CCG is seeking expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced healthcare providers who can provide demonstrable evidence of a track record in transformation and integration across the health and social care economy and is able to set out how they will respond to the need to drive focused change over course of the Contract whilst at the same time having a strong grip on the provision of care that is being delivered. The successful bidder will be expected to deliver services as currently commissioned on day one and then enter into the transformation journey in partnership with the CCG, services users and carers, general practice, the local authority and other stakeholders. The CCG is seeking a strategic partnership and therefore it is envisaged that the contract length will be for a maximum of 10 years. The initial scope of services to be delivered from the May 2019 has been set out within the procurement documentation. However the contract awarded will also contain provisions to enable the CCG to commission additional transformation work with access to funds and extend the scope of services to include an identified additional list of services over the term of the contract. Neither additional transformational funding nor additional services are guaranteed at this stage. A Prospectus for the Single Contract for Out of Hospital Services has been attached to this notice. This document sets out in detail the vision of the CCG and the services within the scope of this procurement. Documents Access to procurement documents associated with this opportunity are available via the EU-Supply Portal.",,,London,"85000000 ","Ekkehard Kugler",ekkehard_kugler@nhs.net,"Perceval House","14/16 Uxbridge Rd",London,"W5 2HL",England,,,"Ealing CCG Single Contract OOH Standards of Care Issued 22032018.pdf Ealing CCG Single Contract OOH - Ealing Community Outcome Based Care Issued 22032018.xlsx Out Of Hospital Services Procurement - Changed date for publication of procurement documents.docx additional information 2.docx SINGLE CONTRACT OOH PROSPECTUS vFINAL - 4 May 2018.pdf ",,"Registration

Potential Bidders, intending to participate through the procurement process are now invited to register an interest and access the procurement documents via the electronic procurement portal EU-Supply available at https://nhssbs.eu-supply.com. Once you have logged into the EU-Supply Portal, SEARCH FOR TENDER REFERENCE 31091.

Registration on EU-Supply is FREE and the attached EU-Supply - Quick User Guide will be helpful. If you need technical support on the EU-Supply Portal, please contact the EU-Supply Helpdesk on 0800 840 2050 or support@eu-supply.com.
Access to procurement documents associated with this opportunity are available via the EU-Supply Portal

The CCG will be holding a briefing session for potential bidders 0900 to 1145 on the 16 May 2018 at the Nelson Room, Ealing Town Hall, New Broadway.  The primary purpose of this event is to provide organisations that may be interested in participating in the delivery of the contract, an opportunity to meet and hear about the opportunity from representatives of the CCG and partner organisations. The event will also be an opportunity for organisations who may be considering participating as a lead or supporting provider, to meet and exchange ideas.
If you wish to attend the event please register your organisation and names of those who will be attending via the EU-Supply Portal .
There are two deadlines for submission of completed bid responses:
DEADLINE 1: The deadline for submitting a response to the Selection Questionnaire (SQ) is 12 noon 19 July 2018. Ealing CCG will not accept responses received after this time and date
DEADLINE 2: The deadline for submission of completed ITT 1 Responses is 12 noon 23 August 2018. Ealing CCG will not accept responses received after this time and date.

For the avoidance of doubt, potential bidders who fail to submit a response to the Selection Questionnaire by deadline 1 will not be permitted to submit a subsequent ITT Response.  Potential bidders may NOT be notified of shortlisting prior to the deadline for submission of completed ITT Responses, and so should not wait until notified before commencing preparation of their ITT Response.  Potential bidders will be notified as soon as possible of the results of the evaluation of their SQ Response following evaluation.  For the avoidance of doubt, Ealing CCG will only evaluate those ITT Responses from Bidders who have been short listed following evaluation of SQ Responses.

Minimum requirements for financial standing and competency will be set out in the Selection Questionnaire document. Providers submitting a response to the Selection Questionnaire that does not satisfy these minimum requirements may be excluded from further participation in this procurement.",01/05/2019,30/04/2029,19/07/2018,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,450245609,450245609,,,,,,,"Other bespoke 2 stage",

CORNWALL001-DN327415-26332131,Contract,"Cornwall Council",Closed,2018-05-01T15:31:23Z,"Minor Works Framework - Cornwall Council DN327415","The Cornwall Council is seeking to establish a multi-supplier minor works construction framework. Therefore, anyone applying for the framework must be able to demonstrate they are able to provide the entire range of works and services and the Council would not be able to appoint contractors able to only undertake a proportion of the works.

The Cornwall Council is conducting this procurement via its E Tendering system which contains all the procurement documentation. ACCESS TO WHICH CAN BE FOUND AT WWW.SUPPLYINGTHESOUTHWEST.ORG.UK. ref:  DN327415  All expressions of interest will be automatically accepted by the portal.

The term of the Framework Agreement is intended to be for four years, commencing in April 2018 and  will comprise one multi-supplier Lot .  This Lot will primarily handle Capital Construction Contracts Minor Works - with discrete Contractor design portions within the county of Cornwall and Plymouth
The works will consist of building and construction works including new build, extensions and refurbishments or other works of a similar nature.

Call offs under the framework will be on the basis of a mini competition between the contractors, or direct award on a basis as set out in the procurement documentation.",,,"South West","45000000 ","Michael Parsons",mparsons1@cornwall.gov.uk,"County Hall","Treyew Road",Truro,"TR1 3AY",England,"+44 1872323049",http://www.cornwall.gov.uk,,,,23/05/2018,01/03/2022,15/05/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Works,250000000,250000000,,,,,,,"Open ",

PLS2017,Contract,"BRACKNELL FOREST COUNCIL",Awarded,2018-04-17T17:39:04Z,"Provision of Leisure Services","Bracknell Forest Council (the ""Council"") is seeking to appoint a leisure management provider to operate 3 facilities: Bracknell Leisure Centre, Coral Reef & Downshire Golf Complex. The proposed contract is for 10 years starting on 1 March 2018 with an optional extension of a period of 5 years. For further information, see ""Additional text"".",,,"South East","92000000 ",,geoff.reynolds@bracknell-forest.gov.uk,"Bracknell Forest Council","Easthampstead House, Town Square",Bracknell,"RG12 1AQ",England,,,,"www.businessportal.southeastiep.gov.uk ","Bracknell Forest Council (the ""Council"") is seeking to appoint a leisure management provider to operate 3 facilities: Bracknell Leisure Centre, Coral Reef & Downshire Golf Complex. The proposed contract is for 10 years starting on 1 March 2018 with an optional extension of a period of 5 years. The services are currently provided in-house by the Council. The centres are well-thought of by local residents, and feature in the resident's survey 'top three things' about living in the Borough and the Council wishes to ensure this continues. The Council will only award the contract if sufficient savings can be made while maintaining the high quality service. The procurement is being let in two separate lots - Lot 1: Bracknell Leisure Centre and Coral Reef and Lot 2: Downshire Golf Complex. Suppliers may bid for one or both Lots. Turnover on all facilities in 2015/16 was £6.7m. Budgeted turnover in 2016/17 is £7.1m, reflecting the reopening of Coral Reef in 2017 after the Council's investment of c.£13m. The Concession Contract Regulations 2016 apply to this procurement (the 'CCR') and the services are ""social and other specific services"" coming under Schedule 3 of CCR. As such the full requirements of the CCR do not apply. The Council is only bound to the extent applicable to Schedule 3 services. The Council intends to follow a ""quasi-restricted procedure"". Details of the procurement are set out in the procurement documentation. If a supplier is selected to tender in both Lots, at tender stage it will be required to submit a separate statement (""Combined Statement"") setting out the benefits and efficiencies to the Council if it is awarded a contract under both Lots. The Council will set out its methodology for evaluating the Combined Statements in its evaluation methodology within the ITT documentation. Selection Questionnaires must be returned by the 31st March 2017. Organisations must specifically register their interest on the South East Business Portal in order to be kept informed of any changes or notifications regarding this process. The Council will not be held responsible for not informing any organisation who has not officially registered on this site. The dates and values presented within this notice are best estimates at the time of publication.",01/03/2018,29/02/2028,31/03/2017,YES,PLS2017,No,Yes,No,Services,119000000,0,21/11/2017,13500000,"[Sports and Leisure Management limited|2 Watling Drive
LE10 3EY|COMPANIES_HOUSE|2204085|No|No]",,01/03/2018,29/02/2028,"Other For further information, see ""Additional text"".",

EC09/01/2422 - Re-issued,Contract,"SOUTHAMPTON CITY COUNCIL",Awarded,2018-04-05T13:29:21Z,"The Provision of Independent Fostering Agency Services","Fourteen (14) local authorities: Southampton City Council, Portsmouth City Council, Oxfordshire County Council, Bournemouth Borough Council, Dorset Council, Isle of Wight Council, Poole Borough Council, Surrey County Council, Reading Borough Council, Slough Children’s Services Trust, Wokingham Borough Council, Bracknell Forest Council, the Royal Borough of Windsor and Maidenhead and West Berkshire Council, (thereby referred to as The Councils) are working together to improve placement choice and quality for the children and young people they look after.

In order to improve placement choice and quality, the Councils wish to work in partnership with a number of providers who can demonstrate that they have the ability to deliver high quality independent foster care services, and work in partnership to ensure a range of placements are available based within or near the Councils boundaries.

This procurement is being run pursuant to Regulations 74, 75 & 76 of Chapter 3 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015. In respect of each Lot, the procured services will be provided under a multi-provider framework agreement with a term of four (4) years.

Annually during the Framework Agreement Term, providers of fostering services similar to, or the same as the Services who are not Framework Providers including those that have previously applied and failed to become a Framework Provider will be given a further opportunity to obtain a place on the fostering framework arrangements of which this Framework Agreement forms a part. The Purchasers will advertise this opportunity before the second and third anniversaries of the Commencement Date and will place the advertisements in Southampton City Council’s E-tendering portal – Curtis Fitch, the Official Journal of European Union (OJEU) and Contract Finder.",,,"South East,South West","85311000 ",,procurement@southampton.gov.uk,"One Guildhall Square",,Southampton,"SO14 7FP",England,,www.southampton.gov.uk,,"https://supplysouthampton.esourcingportal.com/ ","This procurement is being managed by Capita Business Services Limited (“Capita”) on behalf of Southampton City Council under a Strategic Services Partnership. Both Capita and Southampton City Council are delivering this procurement on behalf of the Councils.

The contract between Southampton City Council (Lead Purchaser) and Capita provides for tenders and all information submitted in response to this invitation to tender to be treated as confidential by Capita and not to be used for any other purpose than the provision of services to the Council under the Strategic Services Partnership.

The Councils are subject to the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 and the Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (the Information Acts) and all correspondence received from Bidders may be subject to disclosure in accordance with the Information Acts.  If any tenderer considers that any of the information it submits to the Councils is exempt from disclosure under the Information Acts then this should be stated in writing at the time the information is supplied together with the reason for considering it exempt.  On receipt of an information request relating to the information considered exempt the Councils will, where reasonably practicable, consult with the relevant tenderer in considering any request for disclosure before disclosing such information. However, in submitting any information to the Councils Bidders accept and acknowledge that the Councils may, acting in accordance with the Information Acts and associated codes of practice, disclose information:
a. without consulting the relevant tenderer, or

b. following consultation with the tenderer and having taken its views into account. EC09/01/2457,Contract,"SOUTHAMPTON CITY COUNCIL",Closed,2018-04-04T13:56:08Z,"FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT FOR CHILDREN'S RESIDENTIAL PLACEMENTS - CONSORTIA COMMISSIONING","FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT FOR

Local Authorities across the Southern Region of England have come together to commission children's residential care using a framework agreement that will be reopened yearly. Southampton City Council has taken the lead for the purposes of tendering the opportunity.  The Commissioners met with the market on the 17th July 2017 to discuss future planning and asked the market their views and opinions on a variety of points.

Since the last market engagement the Commissioners have developed a service specification and planned a procurement process with a number of the concerns addressed to ensure the success of the framework for both providers and commissioners in the longer term.

The OJEU Contract Notice for the Framework Agreement will be sent for publication on the 28th February 2018. It is planned that on or around this date we will be publishing a presentation to the market giving outline details of the procurement, including a short summary of how we have responded to questions from the market and how to register to participate in the procurement process.

We are providing the opportunity to the market to ask clarification questions regarding the information provided in the presentation, this can be done by accessing the project on the Curtis Fitch Portal at https://supplysouthampton.esourcingportal.com .  Responses to the clarification questions asked regarding the planned procurement will be published on the Curtis Fitch Portal.  The opportunity to ask clarification questions regarding the planned procurement will close on the 14th March 2018.  It is intended that the Invitation to Tender will be published on the Curtis Fitch Portal on the 16th March 2018.

Further details are included in the OJEU Contract Notice, which includes the details of the Local Authorities included in the Consortia.",,,"South East","85311300 ",,procurement@southampton.gov.uk,"Civic Centre",,SOUTHAMPTON,SO147LY,England,,https://supplysouthampton.esourcingportal.com,"CRC F'work Presentation Final 28.02.18.pdf ",,"Applicants will be required to apply via ""Supply Southampton"" website which can be accessed via, http://www.southampton.gov.uk/business-licensing/supply-council/supply-portal.aspx where you can register your details and access documentation. The Council undertakes to use reasonable endeavours to hold confidential any information provided in the proposal submitted, subject to the Council's obligations under law, including the Freedom of Information Act 2000. If the applicant considers that any of the information submitted in the proposal should not be disclosed because of its sensitivity then this should be stated with the reason for considering it sensitive. The Council will then consider the sensitivity statement before replying to any request received under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. Any enquiries regarding the tender process must be directed through the website to the Curtis Fitch System.",01/08/2018,31/07/2024,08/05/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,1000000000,2000000000,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",

RBC000364,Contract,"READING BOROUGH COUNCIL",Closed,2018-03-30T10:25:01Z,"Leisure Development and Management Services","Reading Borough Council (the Council) is seeking an innovative Strategic Leisure Partner (the Contractor) with the necessary technical knowledge, experience, and capability to enhance and maintain the Council's leisure portfolio. The Council wish to enter into a long-term partnership with a Contractor for a contract duration that is envisaged to be between a minimum of 15 years and a maximum of 25 years. Once in operation the Council may reserve the right to extend the contract term but only to an overall maximum contract length of 25 years. The Council anticipate that the length of the contract period including potential extension period(s) will be a subject discussed with Bidders during the project dialogue phase.

The overarching aim of the project is to transform the current leisure offer in Reading to align with the Council's vision, priorities and outcomes for leisure. The Council wish to secure a Contractor that can deliver an efficient and economically sustainable programme of continued investment in sport, sporting facilities and physical activity over the contract period.

The Council intends to undertake a competitive dialogue process in accordance with Regulation 74, Light Touch Regime (LTR) and that RBC is applying the procedure corresponding to the competitive dialogue procedure with the following variations:
-	30.(5) The contract shall be awarded on the sole basis of the award criterion of the best commercial-technical evaluation criteria detailed in section 18 of this document.

-	30.(8a), (12), (13) The Council envisage utilising Pre-Submission Meetings to provide clarifications to Bidders prior to ISOS and ISDS submissions. The Council envisage Dialogue will be undertaken following ISDS submission once a solution has been presented that enables both parties to engage in dialogue.

The Council reserve the right to make further variations to the dialogue procedure at a later date during the process.",,,"South East","45212110 45212200 45212212 45212290 92610000 ","John Littlefair",john.littlefair@reading.gov.uk,"Bridge Street",,READING,RG12LU,England,"01189372568 ext 72568",,,,"Organisations interested in expressing an interest in this procurement should download the procurement documents which are available on the Council`s e-tendering system at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/readingbc/aspx/Home  and complete as instructed.

Please note: you must register your interest via the Council`s e-tendering portal if you intend to submit a tender. Interested parties must log onto the Council`s e-tendering portal at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/readingbc, to express an interest and download the procurement documents. All communications regarding this procurement exercise will be conducted through the Council`s e-tendering portal including requests for clarifications or general enquiries. 0003,Contract,"HOME OFFICE",Closed,2018-03-21T10:14:18Z,"Home Office Biometrics (HOB) - Strategic Central and Bureau Platforms","The Home Office (Contracting Authority) provides the biometric capability to deliver enrolment, matching, storage & reporting of fingerprints & facial images through two legacy systems
column2: IDENT1 for UK police forces & law enforcement & IABS for immigration, the border force & HMPO. Both contracts expire in 2019.

column1: Significant parts of these systems have already been disaggregated such as the Strategic Matcher functionality
column2: other will follow (such as Front End Equipment, Mobile, Bureau Application & Tools and Interfaces (Biometric Services Gateway).

column1: The Authority is procuring an IT Services contract for significant subsystems within the IDENT1 & IABS systems. These subsystems already exist & have been operational for over 10 years. The successful bidder will be required to carry out the transition of these services from the incumbent suppliers into the new operating model.
The SCBP project will provide the core platform delivering business aware workflow, process management and databases the heart of the future Biometric Service.
The existing and implemented subsystems within scope for SCBP shall include but not be limited to:

•	Front End Equipment Front end equipment providing users with the ability to capture finger print biometrics, search them against, and add them to the existing data sets for a number of business purposes.
•	Bureaux providing the capabilities for finger print experts to manage the biometric workflows, and intervene when errors need to be corrected.
•	The Central IDENT1 and IABS subsystems housing the statically defined national collections
column2: and the flexibly defined 'special collections'. These provide the ability for appropriate users to manage records, search collections and be notified of changes.

column1: For these already built and running subsystems the SCBP Supplier shall provide IT services that include, but not be limited to:
•	Infrastructure support services, including working with the existing data centre provisioning and network supply
•	ITIL Service Management as part of the wider ecosystem
•	Development, testing and deployment of continuous improvement and enhancements. This will be commissioned in support of the known pipeline of work.
There are also Transformation requirements which may be taken up during the term of the contract:-

•	Data centre consolidation. Relocation away from the existing four IDENT1 and IABS Production Data Centres into two Crown Hosting data centres and/or migration of both IDENT1 and IABS applications into the public Cloud
•	Transformation of the highly distributed physical deployment architecture for Bureaux to a centralised and virtualised solution
•	Alignment and integration of the Service and Security Management Tooling in line with established strategies.

Full information, including how to apply for this opportunity, can be found in the Contract Notice reference 2018/S 055-121962 dated 20th March 2018.",,,"Any region","72000000 ","Central Commercial Team",SCBP@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk,"3rd Floor, Metro Point Building, 49 Sydenham Road.",,Croydon,"CR0 2EU",England,,,,"http://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:121962-2018:TEXT:EN:HTML ",,08/03/2019,07/03/2029,23/04/2018,NO,,No,No,No,Services,308000000,0,,,,,,,"CompetitiveProcedureWithNegotiationOJEU ",

SOSBC001-DN330275-22863456,Contract,"Southend-on-Sea Borough Council",Closed,2018-03-21T09:40:34Z,"Better Queensway Regeneration Project","The Council is committed to seeking a partner with whom we will develop a long-term relationship-working together to deliver Better Housing, Better Living, Better Place. We are seeking to establish a genuine partnership, where objectives are aligned, to fund, develop, manage and operate the new scheme. The Council has developed a series of objectives / requirements that build on its vision for Better Queensway of ""Better Housing, Better Living, Better Place"". These Objectives / Requirements express the Council's aspirations for the scheme and the type of partnership that it is seeking to be established to underpin it.

The scheme • The expeditious delivery of a mixed use scheme, with an increase to the 441 affordable homes that are currently provided on the site • The expeditious delivery of a mixed use scheme including the re-provision of the current level of affordable housing • Delivery of a safe, vibrant, integrated and sustainable community that will impact positively on the economic and social well-being of the community, including the establishment and operation of a Community Fund. • Highways works to the Queensway, and broader network with improved pedestrian and cycling connectivity to the town centre whilst still providing convenient and efficient transport links, particularly to the seafront • Accommodation of existing tenants and resident leaseholders who wish to remain, on the same terms and conditions • High quality scheme with high quality homes throughout the development, delivering sustainability during construction and its lifetime • High quality public realm ensuring all buildings are set within attractive useable open spaces in which people feel safe to live, work and play • Demolition of the towers

The partnership • A long-term partner to work with it to fund and develop the mixed use scheme and to fund, manage and maintain all public realm and retained operational units on the site. • The Council requires an ongoing role in the governance of Better Queensway with a strong voice in a variety of key issues. • The Council is seeking to retain freehold ownership of the land on the site, including any aspects purchased through the partnership and will invest the value of this land into the partnership • The Council has some appetite for development risk. Any partnership developed should ensure that risks shared, or taken, by the Council must be balanced by commensurate reward. Any Council investment will need to be balanced by private investment. • The Council expects to receive meaningful financial returns throughout the development and the life of the operation of the scheme. • The partnership must keep stakeholders engaged and informed throughout the life of the scheme.
To view and respond to this opportunity please register on ProContract

column1: ESPO proposes to establish a commercial trading company whose target clients will be third sector organisations such as national and local charities, public sector mutual organisations and other organisations involved in the delivery of services to or for the public sector. The successful Supplier will be asked to enter into an additional separate framework agreement (the Second Framework) with that commercial trading company on materially similar terms to that found in the tender pack to be entered into by ESPO itself.

The trading company will enter into the framework agreement with the successful supplier and make it available to third sector clients who themselves are not required to follow the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or other procurement legislation. BIP57977301,Contract,"Ministry of Defence, DSTL, Defence Science & Technology Laboratory (DSTL)",Closed,2018-03-10T12:45:28Z,"Human and Social Sciences Research Capability (HSSRC)","The Ministry of Defence (MoD), via the Dstl Defence and Security Analysis (DSA) Division, is seeking to appoint a Prime Contractor to lead, manage and deliver research into human capabilities.  The appointed Contractor will be responsible for delivering agile, and cutting-edge human, social and behavioural sciences research, building and maintaining a robust supplier network, with an emphasis on scientific excellence, innovation, and collaboration to exploit research, skills and capabilities.  They will develop effective partnerships to deliver innovative and novel solutions to address current and future problems with responsibility for ensuring programme integration, coherence and exploitation.
The key capability research areas are:
- Health, Well-being and Enhancing Medical Systems and Capabilities
In addition to Dstl and the Ministry of Defence (MOD), the Framework will be available to the following Government departments:
Department for Education, Department for International Trade, Department for Transport, Ministry of Justice, Home Office, College of Policing, Department of Work and Pensions.

The selection criteria in the PQQ contains both pass/fail questions and scored questions.  Should a potential provider record a fail against any of the pass/fail questions they will automatically be deemed non-compliant.  The scored questions shall be weighted and evaluated against the scoring criteria as detailed in section 6 of the PQQ.  The maximum number of potential providers that will be taken through to the ITT stage is six.  In the event that there are more than six compliant potential providers the weighted scores shall be used to down select the six highest.

The information and/or documents for this opportunity are available on http://www.contracts.mod.uk.  You must register on this site to respond, if you are already registered you will not need to register again, simply use your existing username and password. tender_162302/653421,Contract,"Hanover Housing Association",Closed,2018-03-07T16:17:53Z,"Hanover Housing Planned Asset Maintenance & Investment works","Hanover Housing Association are a leading provider of housing for the over 55s and one of the largest providers of Extra Care housing in the UK with circa 19,000 properties over 600 estates across England
Hanover would like to invite competent planned works Contractors to be considered for a strategic planned asset and investment works contract..

The contract opportunity covers the majority of Hanover's planned and cyclical asset investment requirements and is broken into 4 geographical  lots, (North, East, South & West) representing the internal geographical operational structures within Hanover.

Each lot will be awarded to a single Contractor to act as a strategic partner to Hanover to jointly develop and deliver Hanover's planned asset investment and cyclical maintenance programme, taking a strategic whole house approach to delivering the works.
The specific workstreams that will be delivered under each whole house type contract are as follows:
Interior and exterior cyclical decorations (incl. pre-decoration repairs and flooring replacements )
Fire alarm and other fire safety installations

The contracts will be let for 10 years, and whilst there is no guarantee of spend, Hanover estimate the value of each regional contract to be 3.5 to 4m pounds per annum, therefore an estimated 35 to 40 million pounds per contract over the full 10 year term.
Whilst there are no restrictions on bidders who wish to apply for multiple lots, Hanover will only award a successful bidder a maximum of 2 lots.

In order to be considered for the contracts interested parties must be able to demonstrate a minimum turnover for the past 2 years trading accounts of at least 7 million pounds per annum. In addition where 2 lots are to be awarded to a single Contractor, the minimum turnover requirement will be £14 million per annum.

This tender process will be competitive dialogue. Following evaluation of the SQ responses Hanover intend to shortlist the 5 highest scoring bidders to the Invitation to Submit Details Solution (ISDS) stage, and following the ISDS evaluation will further shortlist to 3 bidders to conduct further dialogue with.

A bidders open day will be held on 16 March 2018 where representatives from Hanover will provide further information related to this tender and allow bidders to gain further clarity on the requirements and/or process.
Full details are enclosed within the SQ documentation.

",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Wales","45211200 ",,ams.procurement@hanover.org.uk,"Nelson House, Arlington Road",,"St Neots","PE19 6RE",England,,https://hanover.bravosolution.co.uk,,,,01/04/2019,31/03/2029,06/04/2018,YES,tender_162302/641070,Yes,Yes,No,Works,140000000,160000000,,,,,,,"CompetitiveDialog ",

tender_133341/658454,Contract,"Department for Work and Pensions",Awarded,2018-03-07T10:22:53Z,"DWP Estates Facilities Management","DWPs PRIME PFI with Telereal Trillium is due to expire on the 31/03/2018. DWP will need to replace the Facilities Management (FM) Services provided under PRIME with new contractual arrangements.

Through development of a future contracting strategy, the Department will replace: the current PRIME Contract on expiry, with new affordable contractual arrangements that are aligned with wider government policy and
column2: Facilities Management strategies ensuring greater value for money for the tax payer while also delivering an Estate which is fully fit for purpose and meets the changing needs of the Department.

column1: The new arrangements will ensure continuation of the services currently received under PRIME, enabling DWP to continue to operate its core services to the public.

Under the existing PRIME contract TT provides the majority of these FM services through a sub-contractor, under a Total Facilities Management (TFM) delivery model. TFM is where one provider provides both hard and soft services.

tender_151274/639370,Contract,"NHS England",Awarded,2018-02-27T15:41:07Z,"NHS England Framework Agreement: Midlands and East (Tranche A)","A framework is awarded for the supply of proprietary pharmaceuticals to participating Authorities in the NHS Region: Midlands and East.  The period of the resulting framework is 01 March 2018 - 29 February 2020, with an option to extend (at the Authority's discretion) for a period or periods up to a total of 24 months.

The framework agreement is intended for use by the Department of Health, Public Health England and the NHS in England.  The framework may also be used by private sector contractors and agents working on behalf of the above.

The advertised awarding value of £163 million is the maximum value over the full potential 4 year period.  The initial 2 year period of 1 March 2018 - 29 February 2020 therefore carries an awarding value of £81.5 million (£40.75 million per annum).",,,"East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England","33600000 ","Tom Redfearn",tom.redfearn@nhs.net,"NHS England, Rutland House, Second Floor, Runcorn",,Cheshire,"WA7 2ES",England,"+44 1133916904",https://www.england.nhs.uk/,"CM_PHR_15_5486_00_ABV.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_ALL.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_ALP.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_AMG.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_BMS.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_CHU.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_FER.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_IPN.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_JAN.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_LIL.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_MRZ.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_MSD.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_NEX.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_NOV.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_PCL.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_PFI.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_ROC.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_SDZ.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_SER.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_TVA.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_VIF.pdf CM_PHR_15_5486_00_VIV.pdf ",,"

tender_162245/642980,Pipeline,"Highways England",Closed,2018-02-22T17:58:23Z,"Scalable Free-Flow Charging solution","Highways England is in the early stages of developing a scalable free-flow charging solution for commencement of live service between 2021 and 2024, which will include schemes such as Dartford-Thurrock River Crossing. The solution would be a potential enabler to realising any longer term aspiration of interoperability between charging schemes and a smarter integrated service for the customer. Highways England wishes to speak to the market to gain their insights and experience in this field which will be fed into the development and make-up of the scalable free-flow charging solution.
We anticipate the following industries will be interested in this opportunity:
- Contact centre and Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) companies
- Civil enforcement and debt management providers
- Payment solution providers (e.g. merchant acquirer services)

Interested parties are requested to read the pre-procurement briefing and to confirm their attendance at the market engagement day by emailing TechnologyProcurement@highwaysengland.co.uk by 5pm on 5th February 2018 should they wish to attend. Attendance is strictly restricted to 1 attendee per organisation. Lunch is provided. Interested parties should also outline any specific dietary or accessibility requirements.

Interested parties should also complete the market engagement questionnaire by Friday 23rd February 2018 17:00 GMT. Suppliers will be informed by Monday 5th March 2018 17:00 GMT whether they will be invited to a one-to-one meeting in London. These meetings will be held between 12th-16th March 2018 and 19th-20th March 2018. Please note that suppliers will be assigned a 2 hour non-negotiable slot.

Please note that, due to a fault with the Contracts Finder website, we are unable to publish this notice as an Early Engagement notice. As such, we've had to publish a Future Opportunity notice, but suppliers should deem this an Early Engagement notice (this means that a procurement idea is currently active, it is in the early stage of development and judging interest from potential suppliers).",,"GU1 4LZ","South East","63712210 ",,TechnologyProcurement@highwaysengland.co.uk,"Bridge House, 1 Walnut Tree Close",,Guildford,"GU1 4LZ",England,,,"FFC Pre-procurement briefing.pdf Scalable Free-Flow Charging market engagement event slides.pdf Scalable Free-flow Charging market engagement questionnaire - PDF read only version v3.pdf FFC Supplier Day Q and As 09022018.pdf ","https://goo.gl/forms/f7H7jbRCMHoC5kF43 ",,01/01/2019,01/01/2019,01/01/2001,NO,,Yes,No,No,,150000000,0,,,,,,," ",

DWP_19023 1-6,Contract,"DEPARTMENT FOR WORK AND PENSIONS",Awarded,2018-02-20T14:27:57Z,"Work and Health Programme","The Work and Health Programme (WHP) has been designed in line with the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) five key objectives as set out in the single Departmental Plan : 2015 to 2020, along with plans for how these will be achieved and measured. They are to:
• run an effective welfare system that enables people to achieve financial independence by providing assistance and guidance into employment
• increase saving for, and security in, later life
• create a fair and affordable welfare system which improves the life chances of children and adults
• deliver outstanding services to our customers and claimants
• deliver efficiently: transforming the way we deliver our services to reduce costs and increase efficiency.

DWP will always positively seek to improve and introduce efficiencies in its operations and delivery. DWP will work with the supplier where such improvements impact on processes associated with this Programme.

DWP currently provides additional employment support to those in (or at risk of) long-term unemployment through contracted provision. The largest such contracted provision is the Work Programme. Persons who have a disability with more complex issues are currently assisted by Work Choice, voluntary contracted employment provision which helps participants achieve and stay in employment.Referrals to both the Work Programme and Work Choice are scheduled to end in 2017.
The economic climate and the labour market are considerably stronger than when the Work Programme and Work Choice programmes were designed and introduced.

Given the current labour market conditions the reduced unemployment rate and the improved economic conditions, the contracted employment provision of the future can be smaller and provide more focused support. It will need to provide additional and more intensive support than Jobcentre Plus can offer and deliver sustained employment outcomes above a specified earnings threshold.

The WHP is part of a new Personal Support Package for people with health conditions and disabilities set out in the Work, Health and Disability Green Paper . Making progress on the manifesto ambition to halve the disability employment gap is central to the Government's social reform agenda of building a country and economy that works for everyone.

The WHP will be DWP's new contracted employment provision that will help persons who have a disability, the long term unemployed (LTU) and specified disadvantaged groups to find sustained work. The WHP will target those who are most likely to benefit from the additional support of the programme and will:
• provide additional support that is distinct and additional to that available through Jobcentre Plus
• predominantly remunerate suppliers on a Payment by Results (PbR) basis in order to drive sustained employment outcomes

• support current and future local plans for service integration for individuals who have multiple barriers to work and/or have a disability.",,,"North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,South East,South West,Wales","75000000 79611000 80000000 85000000 ","Sarah Ogden",sarah.ogden1@dwp.gsi.gov.uk,"Hartshead Square",,Sheffield,"S1 2FD",England,,,"CPA6 REMPLOY PRT1.pdf CPA6 REMPLOY PRT2.pdf CPA6 REMPLOY PRT3.pdf CPA1 Shaw Trust Redacted Prt2.PDF CPA1 Shaw Trust Redacted Prt1.PDF CPA1 Shaw Trust Redacted Prt3.PDF CPA2 Reed Redacted Prt1.PDF CPA2 Reed Redacted Prt3.PDF CPA3 Ingeus Redacted Prt1.PDF CPA3 Ingeus Redacted Prt3.PDF CPA5 Shaw Trust Redacted Prt1.PDF CPA5 Shaw Trust Redacted Prt3.PDF CPA2 REED PRT2A.pdf CPA2 REED PRT2B.pdf CPA5 Shaw Trust Redacted Prt2.PDF CPA3 Ingeus Redacted Prt2.PDF CPA4 Pluss Redacted Prt1.pdf CPA4 Pluss Redacted Prt4.pdf CPA4 PLUSS PART 2.pdf CPA4 PLUSS PART 3.pdf WHP Call-Off Specification Final V7 published.docx CPA 1 Shaw Trust Redacted Prt 2 (addt).pdf ",,,03/10/2017,31/10/2024,04/08/2017,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,397522342,0,18/09/2017,397522342,"[The Shaw Trust Limited|Third Floor, 10 Victoria Street, Bristol, BS1 6BN|||No|Yes][Reed in Partnership|94 Chancery Lane, London, WC2A 1DT|||No|No][Ingeus UK Ltd|Fourth Floor, 66 Prescot Street, London, E1 8HG|||No|No][The Pluss Organisation CIC|Merriott House, Office 1 - 4, Hennock Road Central, Marsh Barton, Exeter, EX2 8NP|||Yes|No][Remploy Limited|18C Meridian East, Meridian Business Park, Leicester, LE19 1WZ|||No|No]",,03/10/2017,31/10/2024,"CallOffFromFrameworkAgreement ",

RM6003,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Closed,2018-02-14T14:31:22Z,"Media Buying","The purpose of this Framework Agreement is to provide central government (and the wider public sector) with a new, open and transparent approach for the media buying agency, to provide the best possible outcomes for communication campaigns whilst providing value for the taxpayer. The successful media buying agency needs to be capable of providing excellent customer service, as well as delivering value for money. They must also be willing and capable of working in partnership with media buying agencies to deliver the media buying aspect of fully integrated campaigns for government. The media buying agency will be part of the initial brief to enable integration and ensure the agreed process from strategy to implementation is successful. Government is keen to partner with the right media agency who is agile and can meet the requirements of different government clients (currently 89 different clients) and offer the range of media buying services required grouped into the following areas (strategic implementation, support implementation, buying implementation).",,,"Any region","79341000 92200000 ",,mediabuying@crowncommercial.gov.uk,"The Capital Building","Old Hall Street",Liverpool,"L3 9PP",England,03450103503,https://www.gov.uk/ccs,"Attachment 1 Contract Notice Transparency Information..pdf Attachment 2 Contract Notice Customer List.pdf Media Buying Documents.zip ",,,30/05/2018,29/05/2020,19/03/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,800000000,0,,,,,,,"OpenOJEU ",

MANC001-DN292710-59606879,Contract,"Manchester City Council",Closed,2018-02-13T14:36:41Z,"Management Contract for the refurbishment of Manchester Town Hall & Albert Square","The Council are looking to procure a Management Contractor for the refurbishment of Manchester Town Hall& Albert Square to provide modern office, civic, commercial, visitor & events accommodation. The Town Hall is a Grade 1 Listed building, opened in 1877. The successfully appointed Management Contractor will be responsible for awarding & managing the works by letting a series of Work Packages. The Council will not be responsible for the appointment of any of the Works Packages. The Management Contractor will act as principal contractor & have responsibility for planning & cost control
column2: advising on the packaging of works & managing the delivery of the programme including procuring & entering into the Work Package contracts, management of the supply chain & delivery of all Works Packages
column3: managing the co-ordination of the design team & integration between the project team, the Council & Works Contractors.",,,"North West","45000000 ","Danielle Messina",d.messina@manchester.gov.uk,"Room 407","Town Hall Extension, Level 3",Manchester,"M60 2LA",England,,,,,"Interested parties must submit a completed Selection Questionnaire by way of expression of interest. The Council is using the e-business portal known as THE CHEST (www.the-chest.org.uk). Applicants will need to register their details at the following link https://www.the-chest.org.uk/procontract. Once registered, applicants will be emailed a log-in and password which will allow applicants to gain access to the Selection Questionnaire. Applicants will need to electronically submit the completed Selection Questionnaire and accompanying documentation via the on-line portal by 12 noon on 19 March 2018 in order to request to participate in the project. Any clarification queries must also be submitted via THE CHEST website by the date referred to in the Selection Questionnaire.

column1: The anticipated number of applicants expected to be shortlisted following the evaluation of the Selection Questionnaire is five (5), which will then be reduced to three (3) following the submission and evaluation of the Outline Solution in response to the Invitation to Submit Outline Solution (ISOS).

The successfully appointed Management Contractor will be required to actively participate in the economic and social regeneration of the locality of, and surroundings of, the place of delivery of the contract. Therefore selection and award criteria, specification requirements and contract performance conditions may relate in particular to social and environmental considerations as relevant to the subject matter of this project. The works are likely to occur over a four year period, however the Management Contractor's contract will be of a longer duration to incorporate soft landings and an aftercare periods'.

ESPO001-DN251475-08820828,Contract,ESPO,Awarded,2018-02-08T10:44:22Z,"860_18 Refuse and Recycling products","In this instance ESPO are establishing a national framework for the provision of Refuse and Recycling Products, including but not limited to plastic wheeled bins (2 and 4 wheels), steel wheeled bins (4 wheels), steel wheeled bin maintenance, plastic refuse sacks, compostable liners, food caddies, kerbside boxes, bin lockdown frames, bin housing units, compost bins and composting accessories.
Lot 1A: Supply of Plastic Wheeled Bins (2 Wheeled)
Lot 1B: Supply of Plastic Wheeled Bins (4 Wheeled)
Lot 2: Supply of Steel Wheeled Bins (4 Wheeled)
Lot 3: Bin Maintenance and Repair (Mobile and Factory Based)
Lot 5: Supply of Lockdown Frames for Bins
Lot 6: Supply of Kerbside Recycling Boxes (Including Inner Caddies)
Lot 7: Supply of Stackable Boxes for Waste
Lot 8: Supply of Kerbside Recycling Bags
Lot 9: Supply of Food Waste Containers (Caddies)
Lot 11: Supply of Plastic Refuse Sacks (Bin Bags)
Lot 12: Supply of Waste Housing Units
Lot 13: Total Managed Solutions for Compost Bins
Lot 14: Supply Only of Compost Bins and Ancillary Supplies for Compost Bins
The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months.  The total estimated value stated includes the option period.

As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities

column5: NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services
column8: or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal

NOTTCITY001-DN261503-90040548,Contract,"Nottingham City Council",Awarded,2018-02-06T11:44:30Z,"CPU 1967 Directory of Approved Apprenticeship Training Providers","Nottingham City Council is completing an open accreditation of organisations who are able to deliver apprentice training across England. The national list of approved providers will be called the Directory of Approved Apprenticeship Training Providers (DAAP). The DAAP will be used by Nottingham City Council, it will also be made available for use by public body employers wishing to train apprentices across England. We are now inviting applications from experienced and qualified training providers who are already approved on the Register of Apprenticeship Training Providers. The service agreement will be established for 2 years with a possible extension of 2 further years. NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical Commissioning Group, acting as lead commissioner for NHS South Devon and Torbay Clinical Commissioning Group and Torbay Council seek to commission Community Health & Wellbeing Services for Children and Young People in North, East, West Devon, South Devon and Torbay.

A Section 75 agreement will be in place between Devon County Council and Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical Commissioning Group for the commissioning of some of the services in this procurement.
The services included in this lot are detailed below.
Child & Adolescent Community Mental Health Services (CAMHs)
Nursing and administration contribution to the Multi-Agency Safeguarding Hub (MASH) processes
Children's Learning Disability and Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD)
SEND and Children with Additional Needs and Long Term Conditions:
Nursing and Community Support to include:
Community Children's Nursing (incl. specialist school nursing
Neuro disability and Integrated Therapies to include:
Children's Speech & Language therapy (incl. Early Years Language Consultant Torbay)
Children's Occupational Therapy (NHS and Social Care)

NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical Commissioning Group, acting as lead commissioner for Plymouth City Council seek to commission Community Health, Wellbeing and SEND Support Services for Plymouth.
The services included in this lot are detailed below.

RM3749 Award,Contract,"Crown Commercial Service",Awarded,2018-02-05T09:09:17Z,"Public Sector Resourcing Award","Crown Commercial Service (CCS) has put in place a pan government collaborative Framework Agreement for use by UK public sector bodies identified at VI.3 (and any future successors to these organisations). The Procurement established a single supplier public sector Framework Agreement for the supply of Contingent Workers.
Under the Framework Agreement, the Service Provider shall not be permitted to be an Agency Provider from its own business (or any affiliated businesses).

The Framework Agreement duration is six (6) years (refer to IV.1.3 of the Contract Notice).The duration in Section II 2.7 is for the placing of orders. Call Off Contracts may extend up to a maximum of 18 months after the expiry of the Framework Period (refer to Clause 10 of the Framework Agreement).Contracting Authorities shall not be able to enter into Call Off Contracts anytime after the expiry of the Framework Period.",,,"Any region","79000000 ",,supplier@crowncommercial.gov.uk,"9th Floor, The Capital, Old Hall Street",,Liverpool,"L3 9PP",England,+443450103503,https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/crown-commercial-service,"RM3749 - Public Sector Resourcing Framework Agreement Version 1 - REDACTED 31.01.2018.docx ","http://ted.europa.eu/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:51287-2018:TEXT:EN:HTML&src=0 ",,17/01/2018,16/01/2024,11/12/2017,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,15000000000,0,16/01/2018,15000000000,"[Alexander Mann Solutions Limited|First Floor, 7-11 Bishopsgate, London  EC2N 3AQ, United Kingdom|COMPANIES_HOUSE|02073305|No|No]",,17/01/2018,15/01/2024,"CompetitiveProcedureWithNegotiationOJEU ",

TMBC001-DN320842-03931714,Contract,"Tonbridge & Malling Borough Council & Tunbridge Wells Borough Council",Closed,2018-02-02T16:24:09Z,"South West Kent Waste Partnership - Waste Services Contract 2019","The ""Partner Authorities"" Tonbridge & Malling Borough Council and Tunbridge Wells Borough Council invites you to tender for the South West Kent Waste Partnership - Waste Services Contract 2019. The Partner Authorities are renewing their arrangements for Recycling and Refuse Collection and Street Cleansing services and are now seeking tenders from suppliers for the following:

Tonbridge & Malling Borough Council (TMBC) and Tunbridge Wells Borough Council (TWBC) have been working in partnership with Kent County Council (KCC) to identify and implement cost effective waste collection/processing/disposal and street cleansing services within their respective Administrative Areas. Whilst this Contract relates to the provision of collection and street cleansing services the purpose of the joint working is to minimise the combined WCA/WDA cost impact of waste collection/ street cleansing/ waste processing and disposal and improve recycling performance in so far as it is cost effective to do so.

With regard to street cleansing, this Contract also seeks to maximise the efficiency and effectiveness of the service across the Administrative Area whilst addressing the differing needs and priorities of each authority.
The Partner Authorities will award one contract for the above services to a single contractor across the two authorities for a term of 8 years with an option to extend twice
column2: the first extension for either up to a further 2 or 8 years and the second extension for a period of up to 2 years but only if the contract has already been extended for 8 years.

column1: Dartford Borough Council are administering the procurement process on behalf of the Partner Authorities.

Expressions of interest must be submitted via the advert on the Kent Business Portal (link provided in Additional Details).  The deadline for completed tenders is 12:00 Noon on Monday 30th April 2018.",,,"South East","90500000 ","Dartford Borough Council procurement team",procurement@dartford.gov.uk,"Kings Hill (Head Office)","Gibson Building, Gibson Drive","West Malling","ME19 4LZ",England,"+44 1322343315",http://www.tmbc.gov.uk,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=2299bc25-3308-e811-80ea-005056b64545&p=8691483f-2f3d-e711-80e1-005056b64545 http://ted.europa.eu/TED/notice/udl?uri=TED:NOTICE:48722-2018:TEXT:EN:HTML ",,01/03/2019,31/03/2027,30/04/2018,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,121696500,0,,,,,,,"Open ",

CORNWALL001-DN298356-94148420,Pipeline,"Cornwall Council",Closed,2018-02-02T14:13:43Z,"Home Care and Supportive Lifestyles 2018","MESSAGE SENT ON BEHALF OF NHS KERNOW AND ADULT SOCIAL CARE COMMISSIONING TEAMS
Further to our email of 17 January 2018 it is with regret we write to advise that there will be a further delay to the publication of the Home Care and Supportive Lifestyles Tender.

As you are aware this is one of many integrated commissioning opportunities for health and social care in Cornwall and is also one of the first large scale contracts we are working on together.   The complexity of integrated commissioning has presented some unique unforeseen challenges to the Tender drafting and Officers from both organisations are working hard to overcome these to achieve the best outcomes for people using the services and care providers.

We would like to thank you for your patience and understanding with regard to this Tender, which we now hope to publish by the end of next week. LGSS001-DN243347-48122771,Contract,"Cambridgeshire County Council",Closed,2018-02-01T11:18:16Z,"Cambridgeshire County Council Home and Community Support Services","Tenders are invited for the supply of Home and Community Support Services. The service is for all residents of Cambridgeshire who are identified as having eligible social care needs and all residents of Cambridgeshire and Royston in Hertfordshire where individuals are registered with a Cambridgeshire GP, and are eligible for NHS fully funded Continuing Health Care (CHC) and Joint Funded Health Care from Cambridgeshire and Peterborough CCG. The Authorityhas set up a 'pseudo-DPS' under the Light Touch Regulations. The DPS started on the 1st November 2017. Full details are contained in the tender documents.

The scope of the services includes: older adults, adults of all ages with organic and/or functional mental health problems, people who may be physically frail or with physical disabilities, people who have sensory loss, people who are entering the end stages of life, people with learning disabilities, people with autism, people with cognitive impairment, children and young people, people who are entitled to Continuing Health Care Funding, rapid hospital discharge and transition, delegated health tasks, live-in (24hr) care. All Potential Providers that meet the minimum requirements of the ITT will be accepted on to the DPS. The DPS will then re-open every three months (or other intervals at the Authority's discretion).
*IMPORTANT* - this round of the DPS is open until 12noon on Thursday 22nd February 2018. Submissions will not be accepted after this date and time.

The Authority will call-off the DPS in order to award individual Service Agreements. The call-off procedures are set out in the tender documents. To access the tender documents please register an interest on the LGSS eSourcing Portal (www.lgssprocurementportal.co.uk).",,,"East of England","85000000 ",,sarah.fuller@cambridgeshire.gov.uk,"Shire Hall","Castle Hill",Cambridge,"CB3 0AP",England,,,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=c07f5598-b004-e711-80dd-005056b64545 ",,12/03/2018,31/10/2027,22/02/2018,YES,LGSS001-DN243347-05106810,Yes,Yes,No,Services,300000000,300000000,,,,,,,"Other ",

tender_162031/647703,Contract,HS2,Closed,2018-01-30T10:49:37Z,"Railway Systems Lots 1 and 2 Procurement for Phase 1 and 2a of the HS2 Project","High Speed Two (HS2) Limited ('HS2 Ltd') is the body responsible for developing and promoting the new high speed railway system known as High Speed Two (HS2). HS2 will initially run between London and Birmingham (Phase 1) but will subsequently be extended to link Birmingham to Crewe (Phase 2a) and Crewe to Manchester and the West Midlands to Leeds (Phase 2b). (Phase 2a and 2b are subject to HS2 Ltd achieving Royal Assent).   The Railway Systems tranche of work incorporates a number of critical disciplines for the HS2 Project, including without limitation the design, construction, commissioning and testing of track, overhead catenary, lineside M & E & tunnels, power, signalling and communications. This procurement relates to two Lots:
-	Lot 1 - Track and Overhead Catenary System (OCS) for a High Speed Railway and
-	Lot 2 - Tunnel and Lineside M&E and Tunnel Ventilation for a High Speed Railway.

This procurement is divided into two lots as set out in the remainder of this notice.",,,"West Midlands,London,South West","45230000 ",,scc@hs2.org.uk,"High Speed Two (HS2) Ltd, Two Snowhill, Queensway",,Birmingham,"B4 6GA",England,,,,"https://hs2.bravosolution.co.uk ",,18/12/2019,31/12/2027,21/03/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Works,1880000000,0,,,,,,,"Negotiated ",

DFID 8178 Contract Notice,Contract,"DEPARTMENT FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT",Closed,2018-01-25T15:23:56Z,"DFID 8178 INVEST AFRICA Programme Contract Notice","DFID's aim, through this programme is to contribute towards the economic transformation needed in Africa tocreate more and better jobs and to set countries on a trajectory out of poverty . The programme will supportincreased foreign direct investment (FDI) into manufacturing which in turn will boost productivity by introducingnew technology and management capabilities, increase the capabilities of the workforce and diffuse theseimprovements into the wider economy. The aim of Invest Africa is to generate formal employment, which in turncreates social stability. The recipients of this service will be the Governments of targeted African countries andthe beneficiaries of those services. DFID intends to award a contract for an initial term of 7 years with a budgetrange of £50m - £70m (inclusive of VAT and all applicable government taxes). CORNWALL001-DN316610-86926190,Pipeline,"Cornwall Council",Closed,2018-01-22T16:07:11Z,"Waste and Recycling Collection, Street and Public Open Space Cleansing Services Contract","Cornwall Council (the Authority) is currently working on a major programme for the commissioning of the Authority's future Waste and Recycling Collection, Street and Public Open Space Cleansing services throughout Cornwall that will deliver a cost effective and enhanced performance Contract in line with the Authority's objectives for reducing waste and increasing recycling rates.
For that reason the Authority is keen to explore certain elements of the proposed new Contract, and solutions that may be currently available in the market, for these services.

The Authority is therefore conducting a soft market assessment to explore these elements and better understand the business, technological and innovative solutions that are available. In addition, this will allow the Authority to gauge the level of market interest, and on what terms solutions can be delivered.

The current outsourced contract for 'Waste and Recycling Collection, Street and Beach Cleansing Services' will terminate on 31st March 2020, with the new contract anticipated to commence on 1st April 2020.  It is envisaged this contract will have an initial term of eight (8) years with provision to extend by a further two (2) years, with the estimated term value of the Contract between 20 000 000 GBP per annum and 22 000 000 GBP per annum.
Waste collection services within the new Contract may include but are not limited to, collection of household wastes such as
column4: food
column5: garden
column7: and clinical.  The collection service will also include the Authorities' office/commercial waste
column8: and, to the extent requested under Section 45(1)(b) Environmental Protection Act 1990, commercial waste.  Street and public open space cleansing and associated services may include but are not limited to manual cleansing
column14: litter bin emptying and dog bin emptying
column15: and an element of environmental enforcement.

column1: The estimated date of publication of the contract notice is 3rd July 2018 and it is anticipated that the Authority will be using the competitive dialogue procedure.",,,"South West","90500000 90600000 ","Paul Williams",pwilliams1@cornwall.gov.uk,"County Hall","Treyew Road",Truro,"TR1 3AY",England,"+44 1872322475",http://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk,,,"If you are interested in assisting with the Authority's assessment, then please register your interest to obtain access to the Soft Market Test Questionnaire via https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/ Project reference DN316610.  Please complete the 'Information Required' sections, and return the document electronically, via the Due North Portal, by 15:00 on Wednesday 7th February 2018.

As a result of the completed questionnaires, some potential providers may be invited to soft market engagement sessions to discuss their proposals with key Authority representatives. It is anticipated these sessions will be held between 20th February - 23rd February 2018 inclusive.

The Authority reserves the right to limit the number of potential providers invited to these engagement sessions. However, this does not mean that potential providers not invited to attend such a meeting will be excluded from the procurement at that stage.

Any further information surrounding this soft market assessment including any information on the soft market engagement sessions and the Authority's aims, objectives and priorities will be made available to all registered parties via https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/, Project reference DN316610.

This advertisement is an indication of potential future procurement activity and is subject to change.  The advertisement, soft market test questionnaire and any subsequent market engagement sessions form no part of any pre-qualification or selection process and as such, this implies no commercial commitment by the Authority.

PIN - Home Office Biometrics (HOB) - Strategic Central and Bureau Platform,Pipeline,"HOME OFFICE",Closed,2018-01-10T11:33:11Z,"PIN Home Office Biometrics (HOB) - Strategic Central and Bureau Platform","The Home Office is the UK's lead Government Department for immigration and borders, passports, drugs policy, crime, fire, counter-terrorism and the Police. The Home Office Biometrics Programme (HOB) provides the biometric capability to support law enforcement, immigration, border security and UK passports (HMPO). It covers three primary biometric modalities: fingerprints, DNA and facial matching. HOB is responsible for two legacy national biometric systems (IABS and IDENT1) that provide this core biometric capability, each provided under contracts with clear duplication of components and functions. With the two contracts terminating in March 2019 (FABrIC for the IDENT1 system) and April 2019 (NBIS for the IABS system), neither can provide all of the capabilities required to achieve the HOB strategic objectives. This procurement is for a single service management capability, developing a Strategic and Central Bureau Platform (SCBP) as part of the Home Office Biometric (HOB) Programme.

The Contracting Authority intends to procure a single service management capability for the IABS and IDENT1 systems, developing a Strategic and Central Bureau Platform (SCBP) as part of the Home Office Biometric (HOB) Programme. The procurement will transition service management of the IDENT1 and IABS systems to a single supplier, with some service improvements.
The contract duration will be for an initial term of six (6) years with an option to extend by two (2) years and then by a further two (2) Years (i.e.10 years altogether)
Estimated costs excluding VAT at 6 years are up to £198 million GBP, at 10 years up to £308 million GBP.
The scope encompasses service transition of core components for the IDENT1 and IABS systems to a single supplier with some service improvements. It comprises of:
-	Application support and maintenance of the in scope subsystem applications and the business capabilities and system functions they deliver.
-	Infrastructure support services as for the in scope subsystems, including working with the existing data centre provisioning and network supply.
-	Security support services for the in-scope sub-systems
-	ITIL Service Management for the subsystems in scope as part of the wider HOB and Authority ecosystem
-	Development, testing and deployment of changes. These changes will be commissioned by the Authority in support of the known pipeline of work and change.
Additional requirements, defined as Scenarios, which may be taken up during the term:
-	Data centre consolidation into two data centres through relocation away from the existing IDENT1 production Data Centres into the existing IABS Data Centres
-	Migration of both IDENT1 and IABS applications into a Public Cloud hosting environment
-	Transformation of the highly distributed physical deployment architecture for Bureau to a centralised and virtualised solution

-	Alignment and integration of the Service and Security Management Tooling in line with Authority strategy.",,,London,"72000000 ","For Attention of Central Team",SCBP@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk,"49 Sydenham Road",,Croydon,"CR0 2EU",England,,www.homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk,"2018-OJS005-007075-en-ts.pdf ","https://gpsesourcing.cabinetoffice.gov.uk/ ","This PIN notice is further to  the Strategic Central and Bureau Platform RFI and Supplier day events both conducted during 2017.
You have been invited to participate in Prior Information Notice Strategic Central and Bureau Platform PIN Registration
Please follow the instructions below to access the notice:-
i. Enter your user name in the Name field.
ii. Enter your password in the Password field.
2. From the main menu select Notice > Manage Notices.
3. Locate the Notice Name in the list of Notices.
4. Click on the Notice Name link to view the Notice.

This procurement process and contract will require bidders to operate at OFFICIAL and OFFICIAL SENSITIVE Classifications. The contracted supplier will additionally be required to operate at SECRET to service the contract.

The Selection Questionnaire (SQ) for this procurement is classified at OFFICIAL and carries a requirement for a signed Non Disclosure Agreement (NDA) to participate at this initial stage. All documentation and information should be handled in accordance with this.

Information and documentation supporting the Invitation To Tender (ITT) is classified at OFFICIAL SENSITIVE. All bid team personnel involved in the ITT response must hold security clearances (SC) registered (not held) with the Home Office. To ensure no time lag is caused to ITT information release by a supplier's registration of or application for SC with the Home Office, the Contracting Authority advises potential bidders to register security clearances after viewing this PIN. Please see additional information attached. Currently the planned date of dispatch of an OJEU Notice is Q1 2018.

Post contract award, personnel involved in the design, delivery and testing of the solution must hold security clearances (SC) from the Home Office and Police Service and, depending on the role and level of access to live systems and data, may also require Non Police Personnel Vetting- Level 3 and Developed Vetting. Contact the Authority on the email address supplied for any points for clarification",30/09/2018,29/09/2028,28/02/2018,NO,,No,No,No,,198000000,308000000,,,,,,," ",
